commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I724253e122ff131c46da64cf05e069aeca6c4e63

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I595e1eb1908a5fb8d389edd4342ec346e70671d3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-28 15:58:33.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that manager.py exits cleanly if charm closes socket

In the related bug, the manager.py was crashing as it received
(essentially) a socket close which resulted in no data being received.
This wasn't handled properly resulting in a crash in the manager.py.
This change simply allows the manager.py to exit cleanly, and the charm
can restart it if it needs to.

Change-Id: I76a435f48cdb8c201b0ddc529da947e6ed9ec031
Related-Bug: #1822063
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that manager.py exits cleanly if charm closes socket

In the related bug, the manager.py was crashing as it received
(essentially) a socket close which resulted in no data being received.
This wasn't handled properly resulting in a crash in the manager.py.
This change simply allows the manager.py to exit cleanly, and the charm
can restart it if it needs to.

Change-Id: I76a435f48cdb8c201b0ddc529da947e6ed9ec031
Related-Bug: #1822063

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 18:33:16.000000000', 'message': 'Do not log a warning about not using compute monitors

The compute_monitors configuration option is empty by
default, however, on nova-compute startup we get a warning
logged saying:

  Excluding nova.compute.monitors.cpu monitor virt_driver. \
  Not in the list of enabled monitors (CONF.compute_monitors).

This is unnecessary noise in the logs when nova-compute is
not configured to use monitors, so this change avoids the warning
log message in that case.

The compute_monitors configuration option help text is also
updated to (1) fix formatting and (2) remove the mention of the
numa_mem_bw monitor which never made it into nova (see
blueprint memory-bw).

Change-Id: I5bd204e0017f6f795e3cf13b34b75124ee23aa78
Closes-Bug: #1823207
'}]
commit_message:
Do not log a warning about not using compute monitors

The compute_monitors configuration option is empty by
default, however, on nova-compute startup we get a warning
logged saying:

  Excluding nova.compute.monitors.cpu monitor virt_driver. \
  Not in the list of enabled monitors (CONF.compute_monitors).

This is unnecessary noise in the logs when nova-compute is
not configured to use monitors, so this change avoids the warning
log message in that case.

The compute_monitors configuration option help text is also
updated to (1) fix formatting and (2) remove the mention of the
numa_mem_bw monitor which never made it into nova (see
blueprint memory-bw).

Change-Id: I5bd204e0017f6f795e3cf13b34b75124ee23aa78
Closes-Bug: #1823207

commit_message:
Ensure we get a value for manifest digest

Some registry implementations do not serve the Docker-Content-Digest
which we currently expect.  According to the spec[1] this is optional
anyway.

This change checks for the header and if it doesn't exist it
calculates the digest from the manifest content.

[1] https://docs.docker.com/registry/spec/api/#content-digests
Change-Id: Ica4bdefb6b8b97e67356cc3ac0e0307689b46c80
Closes-Bug: #1822915

commit_message:
Switch to topology_map

We would like to remove the --*-scale options from the cli so we need to
be able to configure the Overcloud<role>Count options instead. This
change switches from using topology to topology_map to express the
topology configuration.

Change-Id: Ifff664d8f75bd29fa764ef0cdf780627f648e689
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/648562/

commit_message:
change the dist name to 'openstack-heat'

We are updating all Python projects to publish artifacts to PyPI. The
name "heat" is already taken there by another project, and they have
rejected our request to claim the name. We therefore need to change the
dist name used to package heat. We have some other projects publishing
using an "openstack-" prefix, so I propose using the name
"openstack-heat". This will not change the imports or anything else
about how the code works, just how it is packaged.

Add a grenade plugin for upgrading between the packages with different
names so that we can clean up the old version of the code and avoid
discovering the heat plugins multiple times in different locations.

Change-Id: I59b55cffd9e648f842eb286b936f09c5b55a76db
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8ae5f8657b2bdf841bdf114b49839700c2ee924f)

subject: change the way to get tunnel device
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8898, 'name': 'Chris Wedgwood', 'email': 'cw@f00f.org', 'username': 'anticw'}, {'_account_id': 17591, 'name': 'Steve Wilkerson', 'email': 'wilkers.steve@gmail.com', 'username': 'srwilkers'}, {'_account_id': 20466, 'name': 'Tin Lam', 'email': 'tin@lam.wtf', 'username': 'tinlam'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23928, 'name': 'Pete Birley', 'email': 'petebirley@gmail.com', 'username': 'portdirect'}, {'_account_id': 29668, 'name': 'cheng li', 'email': 'cheng1.li@intel.com', 'username': 'chengli3'}, {'_account_id': 29674, 'name': 'Hyunkook Cho', 'email': 'hk0713.cho@samsung.com', 'username': 'hk0713.cho'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 29674, 'date': '2019-03-18 10:23:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29674, 'date': '2019-03-18 10:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Topic TB_190308_getting_tunel_interface_by_c removed'}, {'account_id': 29668, 'date': '2019-03-31 08:11:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I like this idea, it's awesome."}, {'account_id': 29674, 'date': '2019-04-01 08:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29674, 'date': '2019-04-01 09:00:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29674, 'date': '2019-04-01 09:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Topic TB_190308_getting_tunel_interface_by_c removed'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2019-04-05 05:30:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

i take it the goal here is that you know the cidr present on an interface but not the interface name?



the logic we have now is already a bit fragile / quirky, in part because of shell scripting

i have to convince myself this doesn't make that worse

also, it requires an exact cidr match ... not cidr containing, or something we would get from ip route"}, {'account_id': 29668, 'date': '2019-04-05 06:48:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Chris, explicitly specify the interface for vxlan is great. But for multi nodes deployment, if their interfaces are different, this patch would be really useful.

In fact, I was thinking of implementing per-host overrides of vxlan interface. So that we don't have to use same interface name for all nodes. But when I saw this patch, I think this is a better solution.

Because with this patch, I don't have to collect the node interface information(mainly the node interface map, i.e. {node1: eth0, node2: eth1} ). 
The only concern I have with this patch is this doesn't support vxlan cross multi subnets, like below case.
node1(192.168.1.0/24) ----router----- node2(192.168.100.0/24)"}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2019-04-07 19:12:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

i'm gonna +2 this because it passes the gates, looks to solve a real problem for you without breaking things

the caveat is that i really dislike all this code already without adding to it :/"}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-04-08 13:47:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

like chris i have some concerns about how we drive this config atm, though this change does solve a real-world problem and is limited in scope to that, so +2.

I think we should probably move this config to live under `conf` so we can use host/label targeted over-rides to drive agents explicitly, but that's out of scope here."}]

commit_message:
change the way to get tunnel device

to set local_ip in osh, you have to use nic name.
but some devices can have different nic name.
so I add new option for getting tunnel device by cidr.

Added value:
network:
  interface:
    tunnel: null
    tunnel_network_cidr: "0/0"

Change-Id: I8bffae640dfe0086de0b5274bb8c3cdce9754160
Signed-off-by: Hyunkook Cho <hk0713.cho@samsung.com>

[{'created': '2019-04-03 10:53:50.000000000', 'message': 'tempest_services var for setting tempest_service_available_{}

Currently os_tempest is used by multiple deployement tools
and each of them have different methods of configuring
services and currently tempest_service_available_{service_name}
are setted based on group vars and group vars is not used at
all places which leads enable user to specifically define a
list of tempest_service_available_{service_name} which is too
hectic.

By introducing tempest_services:
                 - aodh
                 - neutron
will set those vars automatically and makes it easier for
handling tempest_service_availabe vars.

Change-Id: I8734f38206b73e6547a6ec545f07f625e844ed66
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
tempest_services var for setting tempest_service_available_{}

Currently os_tempest is used by multiple deployement tools
and each of them have different methods of configuring
services and currently tempest_service_available_{service_name}
are setted based on group vars and group vars is not used at
all places which leads enable user to specifically define a
list of tempest_service_available_{service_name} which is too
hectic.

By introducing tempest_services:
                 - aodh
                 - neutron
will set those vars automatically and makes it easier for
handling tempest_service_availabe vars.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/649653/

Change-Id: I8734f38206b73e6547a6ec545f07f625e844ed66
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-05 17:53:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix slow SG api calls when limiting fields

Relating to the issue with creating rules, when reading security
groups, it is very slow. Even when limiting to id/name, it pulls
in all rules before returning just id/name.

This change looks at the fields requested, and if no "synthetic"
fields are in the list, skips initializing those.

Use dynamic lazy mode for fetching security group rules

In conjunction with the prior fix to only get a subset of fields
when needed, this makes the querying of non-rules SG objects
very very fast.

Before the two fixes, if you have about ten security groups with 2000 rules each:

list all: 14s
list all, just 'id' field: 14s
list one: 0.6s
list one, just 'id' field: 0.6s

With just the previous partial fix:

list all: 14s
list all, just 'id' field: 6s
list one: 0.6s
list one, just 'id' field: 0.2s

Now with this change:

list all: 14s
list all, just 'id' field: 0.04s
list one: 0.6s
list one, just 'id' field: 0.03s

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu<hongbin.lu@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1810563
Change-Id: Id6870633e3943666e9b7fb900ad2d0894ee2715d
(cherry picked from commit 1d41f39ddf23b131a8960ac718ed9f8f015f3702)
(squashed Change-Id: I15df276ba7dbcb3763ab20b63b26cddf2d594954)
(cherry picked from commit 1e9086f6e269f32d1cb19a0f55eb1f5dd73ca651)
'}, {'created': '2019-04-06 02:36:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix slow SG api calls when limiting fields

commit_message:
Fix slow SG api calls when limiting fields

Relating to the issue with creating rules, when reading security
groups, it is very slow. Even when limiting to id/name, it pulls
in all rules before returning just id/name.

This change looks at the fields requested, and if no "synthetic"
fields are in the list, skips initializing those.

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu<hongbin.lu@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1810563
Change-Id: Id6870633e3943666e9b7fb900ad2d0894ee2715d

[{'created': '2019-03-27 15:23:46.000000000', 'message': "Increase nb_cfg when needed only (reducing the # of transactions)

Prior to this patch, any transaction to NBDB would result in the nb_cfg
from NBDB being increased by 1. That would propagated to the SBDB and
the metadata agent would get an event which would result in yet another
transaction being created to update the Chassis' external_ids (SBDB)
column to inform that the agent was alive.

This patch is changing that behavior to bump the nb_cfg only when
the get_agents() API call is invoked which would reduce the number
of transactions created in the SBDB due to our current health check
mechanism.

Closes-Bug: #1814698
Change-Id: I6f91955444e0601f10f2d5e509d4a4453def5f2b
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9ee16bf283e612216a0be0a3d8f86e0263e0cc55)
"}]
commit_message:
Increase nb_cfg when needed only (reducing the # of transactions)

Prior to this patch, any transaction to NBDB would result in the nb_cfg
from NBDB being increased by 1. That would propagated to the SBDB and
the metadata agent would get an event which would result in yet another
transaction being created to update the Chassis' external_ids (SBDB)
column to inform that the agent was alive.

This patch is changing that behavior to bump the nb_cfg only when
the get_agents() API call is invoked which would reduce the number
of transactions created in the SBDB due to our current health check
mechanism.

Closes-Bug: #1814698
Change-Id: I6f91955444e0601f10f2d5e509d4a4453def5f2b
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9ee16bf283e612216a0be0a3d8f86e0263e0cc55)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I78cc9ed8078ca2577e1f9ed070dd53b791559ef1

subject: Use last released commit when tagging EOL
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-05 22:12:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-06 09:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-04-06 19:26:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-06 19:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-04-06 20:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-08 05:05:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-04-08 09:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Alternatively we can give another argument to new_release, which represents a ref, defaulting to HEAD.

When someone wants to use a certain reference instead of head, like a specific sha or tag, this gets resolved into a sha, and passed properly.

It allows flexibility, and clarity. By default, the behaviour is not changed, and the policy to decide what to do is independent of the code to do it.

It allows PTLs to also deliver some new release on specific shas, which could happen for some specific cases.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-04-08 09:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Alternatively we can give another argument to new_release, which
 > represents a ref, defaulting to HEAD.
 > 
 > When someone wants to use a certain reference instead of head, like
 > a specific sha or tag, this gets resolved into a sha, and passed
 > properly.
 > 
 > It allows flexibility, and clarity. By default, the behaviour is
 > not changed, and the policy to decide what to do is independent of
 > the code to do it.
 > 
 > It allows PTLs to also deliver some new release on specific shas,
 > which could happen for some specific cases.

ofc this would complexify validation, but the EOL case can be just that -- a validation. 

I am not sure if this idea is worth it or not, or if I am totally out of my league.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-08 11:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> (1 comment)

OK, that makes sense. I was thinking that if it was not released, it wasn't really "available", but thinking now, even though we encourage a final release before the transition, we should still pick up whatever is left.

Update coming.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-04-08 12:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Alternatively we can give another argument to new_release, which
 > represents a ref, defaulting to HEAD.
 > 
 > When someone wants to use a certain reference instead of head, like
 > a specific sha or tag, this gets resolved into a sha, and passed
 > properly.
 > 
 > It allows flexibility, and clarity. By default, the behaviour is
 > not changed, and the policy to decide what to do is independent of
 > the code to do it.
 > 
 > It allows PTLs to also deliver some new release on specific shas,
 > which could happen for some specific cases.

We could do that, but they could also just edit the YAML file directly for those cases. The point of new-release is to "make the easy things easy" and remove the need for a bunch of thought from the process.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-08 13:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Use last released commit when tagging EOL

new-release was grabbing the latest commit when adding an EOL tag. This
tag should only be set on released commits. This updates the logic to
use the same commit hash as the last release before going EOL.

Change-Id: I05308aaead044889717c754cffeb0daf57fdc399
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

If apt-get install failed, the whole image layer failed and is not present. then will retry to create the layer again from the beginning, the previous layer have to succeed and clean all was executed right.
I don't recall in other case, if you have please share it.

Anyway, this change is pointing to stable/ocata branch without following stable policy (first master, then backport to ocata)"}, {'account_id': 25396, 'date': '2017-03-11 09:47:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> If apt-get install failed, the whole image layer failed and is not
 > present. then will retry to create the layer again from the
 > beginning, the previous layer have to succeed and clean all was
 > executed right.
 > I don't recall in other case, if you have please share it.
 > 
 > Anyway, this change is pointing to stable/ocata branch without
 > following stable policy (first master, then backport to ocata)

Maybe you are right. I got this problem when i build mariadb.
If there is just one 'apt install' stage in the whole image layer and the stage failed (e.g. missed archive version in a apt repository), then 'apt clean' will not be executed. and the whole image layer will always be failed.

But I'm not sure about this case, so I don't know if it is necessary to put it to master."}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-03-15 08:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Change is in master already: 

Change-Id: I5ba5b2067566639b399329b878027d4513567f71'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-08 13:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Very old'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-10 02:47:40.000000000', 'message': "failing to fetch some archives for missing archive version in apt repository

Add 'apt-get clean && apt-get update'  to avoid failing to fetch
some archives, such as missing archive version
for new version published in some apt repositories .
We shoule clean the cache and update again.

commit_message:
failing to fetch some archives for missing archive version

Add 'apt-get update' to avoid failing to fetch
some archives, such as missing archive version
for new version published in some apt repositories.
We should execute 'apt update' again.

Change-Id: Iaf394c3d820edec9c9cccbf89774807c2f3d594b
Closes-Bug: #1671676

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I0de68389b0f387b37edaf1bfad3f3b5b1d011873

commit_message:
nova-libvirt: fix nova user permissions for ubuntu for /dev/kvm

In xenial with newer libvirt, an error [1] occurs because the nova
user is not part of the 'kvm' group, which is the group that has
group ownership over the /dev/kvm file. As such, no new VMs can be
deployed. This commit adds the 'nova' user to the 'kvm' group so that
it can launch VMs.

[1] ERROR nova.scheduler.utils [req-41619bcc-0dec-4ff2-b106-648815c18409 7c25b3de8ddc44df96128f12b4a773e9 4d3b49f5654145c685336c108ac65e76 - default default] [instance: 826b3f5f-d149-4783-a51c-f73f66c2a706] Error from last host: compute002 (compute002): [u'Traceback (most recent call last):\n', u'  File "/var/lib/kolla/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1826, in _do_build_and_run_instance\n    filter_properties)\n', u'  File "/var/lib/kolla/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py", line 2056, in _build_and_run_instance\n    instance_uuid=instance.uuid, reason=six.text_type(e))\n', u'RescheduledException: Build of instance 826b3f5f-d149-4783-a51c-f73f66c2a706 was re-scheduled: internal error: process exited while connecting to monitor: Could not access KVM kernel module: Permission denied\nfailed to initialize KVM: Permission denied\n']

Change-Id: I8c669ea82095fed0239c8dc25bc7b2b2182d3d08

subject: DNM: Use Jinja variables for version-dependent packages
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-12 10:21:18.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Use Jinja variables for version-dependent packages

Some packages have different names, depending on whether they are for
Python 2 or Python 3. To avoid complicating our package list logic
further, this patch uses Jinja variables to define the names of packages
that are dependent on python 2 vs. 3.

Change-Id: I8000455c33633a8688916204a66c28063ebcea18
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Use Jinja variables for version-dependent packages

Some packages have different names, depending on whether they are for
Python 2 or Python 3. To avoid complicating our package list logic
further, this patch uses Jinja variables to define the names of packages
that are dependent on python 2 vs. 3.

Change-Id: I8000455c33633a8688916204a66c28063ebcea18
Related-Blueprint: python3-support

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-03-26 10:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-03-27 09:37:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-04-05 23:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-04-08 10:17:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-24 21:38:05.000000000', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I63861d33075e479d584fc359689eec4a55fcc7b6
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I63861d33075e479d584fc359689eec4a55fcc7b6

commit_message:
Add node_uuid field to Destination object

This patch adds `node_uuid` field to `Destination` object.
This parameter is used to store the uuid of the target node.

Change-Id: I888718e28bb86a5ad3a976158bd8f0c54f6cbf10
Blueprint: use-placement-in-tree

commit_message:
Pass node uuid to new Destination.node_uuid

This patch changes the following paths to pass the target node uuid to
Destination.node_uuid in the RequestSpec object:

 - Migrate/Live-migrate/Evacuate to a specified host

The following paths are not affected.

 - Create in a specified host
 - Rebuild in the same host

Change-Id: I216112d1c52ad9a5e70636858ee3d418ef475136
Blueprint: use-placement-in-tree

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I96c123ce42e85583dc77a044848a6a63166dc7c5
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-05 15:38:53.000000000', 'message': "deployed-server: start and enable network service

On the new versions of RHEL, the network service isn't enabled by
default because this mechanism became legacy.
However, our os-net-config doesn't use the new network manager, so we
still rely on on the network service to manage things like the virtual

Closes-Bug: #1823353

commit_message:
deployed-server: start and enable network service

On the new versions of RHEL, the network service isn't enabled by
default because this mechanism became legacy.
However, our os-net-config doesn't use the new network manager, so we
still rely on on the network service to manage things like the virtual
bridges on the Undercloud and the Overcloud.

Change-Id: Iceeeef8535738093be2438abd9deec99f5d61c1b
Closes-Bug: #1823353

commit_message:
Bump psycopg2 lowest version

There is a bug in 2.6 line of psycopg2 that does not properly detect
Postgresql 10 versions.

https://github.com/psycopg/psycopg2/issues/489

Change-Id: If5f773fb9e1ee2cb4e3fff71cd65539caa065e10
(cherry picked from commit 85d7d6520daaaa25e116d4efb673898df2932528)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 07:58:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix setting of VIP QoS policy

Load balancers were going in to ERROR when updating vip_qos_policy_id in
two different cases:

- QoS extension enabled: the VIP DB data model was incorrectly
  constructed ('vip_qos_policy_id' where it should have been
  'qos_policy_id')
- QoS extension disabled: setting an UUID or None would fail in the LB
  update flow as the extension is disabled, and the API would return
  HTTP 202 to the user.

Conflicts:
    octavia/network/base.py
    octavia/network/drivers/noop_driver/driver.py
    octavia/tests/unit/api/drivers/amphora_driver/test_amphora_driver.py

Story: 2004602
Task: 28512

Change-Id: Ie974afa52fe70cbab72b7e7f75bf7ee1015e148c

commit_message:
Fix setting of VIP QoS policy

Load balancers were going in to ERROR when updating vip_qos_policy_id in
two different cases:

- QoS extension enabled: the VIP DB data model was incorrectly
  constructed ('vip_qos_policy_id' where it should have been
  'qos_policy_id')
- QoS extension disabled: setting an UUID or None would fail in the LB
  update flow as the extension is disabled, and the API would return
  HTTP 202 to the user.

Conflicts:
    octavia/network/base.py
    octavia/network/drivers/noop_driver/driver.py
    octavia/tests/unit/api/drivers/amphora_driver/test_amphora_driver.py

Story: 2004602
Task: 28512

Change-Id: Ie974afa52fe70cbab72b7e7f75bf7ee1015e148c
(cherry picked from commit e0c45ce4d288aa0a8c855754245cd3949e54fa3d)
(cherry picked from commit 86e3eb4cab9610e15cc67381908b3619134d2909)

commit_message:
Improve error handling for ChassisMetadataAgentEvent

The ChassisMetadataAgentEvent class is suppose to handle events which
are triggered when a Chassis entry is created or updated in the OVSDB.
Prior to this patch, it was assumed that the external_ids column of that
entry would contain the "neutron:ovn-metadata-sb-cfg" key in it which is
not always true.

This patch is fixing the problem by handling the case which that key is
not yet present in the Chassis external_ids column.

Change-Id: Ie7f348a70a6f0c67f1822f73e0c559eac46b18bb
Closes-Bug: #1816033
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit c88d989eee5b4331d9ff024595741439bc10ee15)

commit_message:
cassandra contact_points bug

persister get contact_points from configuration file
with "[ip.dest for ip in conf.cassandra.contact_points]".
cfg.dest replace "-" with "_".if user config cassandra
hosts cassandra-0,then persister crashed.
Task: 29957
Story: 2005195

Change-Id: I9ee29fdce781739f06683e4b4a80183669663189

subject: Add support for autoeviction of slow nodes.
messages:
[{'account_id': 30128, 'date': '2019-03-16 08:39:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-03-16 08:39:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-03-25 15:41:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Thanks for this change! I have just a couple of things I'd like to see changed"}, {'account_id': 30128, 'date': '2019-03-26 17:39:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-03-27 07:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-03-27 08:12:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

What will happen when this configuration is changed post-deploy? As it changes the evs.version from 0 to 1, will this affect replication between nodes on dirrerent versions?'}, {'account_id': 30128, 'date': '2019-03-27 20:22:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> What will happen when this configuration is changed post-deploy? As
 > it changes the evs.version from 0 to 1, will this affect
 > replication between nodes on dirrerent versions?

You mean as the config is gradually applied to each node in the cluster ?
According to https://www.percona.com/blog/2014/11/25/percona-xtradb-cluster-5-6-21-25-8-now-available/ it shouldn't cause any issues but I have to admit I didn't try it :
"During the EVS protocol upgrade all membership changes are communicated over EVS protocol version 0 to preserve backwards compatibility, protocol is upgraded to the highest commonly supported version when forming a new group so if there exist a single node with older version in the group, the group protocol version remains as 0 and auto-eviction is not functional."'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-03-28 07:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Cool, sounds good to me! Thanks again for this change and sorry for the delay in responding to it!'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-03-28 14:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as Ib4693541bfae854a2f15323d8e114fedc057c2e6'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-03-28 14:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

It looks like this needs to be reverted, and reworked. It is being reverted in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/648404/ because it breaks all deploys at Trusty.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-03-28 14:06:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 30128, 'date': '2019-03-28 15:45:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Breaks them how ?
Will 'charm-recheck-full' provide some clues ?"}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-03-28 16:15:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Well, what that charm-recheck-full did was to run the entire test quite on all of the supported Ubuntu/OpenStack combinations. The fact that it did pass is interesting and will require further investigation.'}, {'account_id': 30128, 'date': '2019-03-28 16:33:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ah yes evs.version 1 was introduced in Percona 5.6 and Trusty comes with 5.5.
New commit or amend ?'}, {'account_id': 30128, 'date': '2019-03-28 19:44:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ok I know what happened

- As agreed I set the default value of autoevict to '0' instead of None
- In get_wsrep_provider_options the check was if config('autoevict') is not None so with a default value of 0 it still applied 'evs.version=1' in my.cnf which is not supported by Percona 5.5 that ships with Trusty.

I'll submit a new patch"}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-03-29 07:18:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

It'll either need to be a new commit, or you can add another revert onto my revert, and update on top of that"}, {'account_id': 30128, 'date': '2019-03-31 10:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I get 'remote rejected' due to "change https://review.openstack.org/643701 closed"
What should I do ?'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-04-01 06:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Create a new patchset, rather than trying to update this one'}, {'account_id': 30128, 'date': '2019-04-08 12:04:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I've created a new one, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/649083/"}]

commit_message:
Timeout policy must fail task without retry

Added new `force` parameter to complete task function. The default
value is False. If force equals True, task doesn't execute a after
complete policy.

Change-Id: I5ae6a922e1fde60ab80ebd7ca81a5aff5ca2df9b
Closes-bug: #1767352
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-05 17:55:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix slow SG api calls when limiting fields

Relating to the issue with creating rules, when reading security
groups, it is very slow. Even when limiting to id/name, it pulls
in all rules before returning just id/name.

This change looks at the fields requested, and if no "synthetic"
fields are in the list, skips initializing those.

Use dynamic lazy mode for fetching security group rules

In conjunction with the prior fix to only get a subset of fields
when needed, this makes the querying of non-rules SG objects
very very fast.

Before the two fixes, if you have about ten security groups with 2000 rules each:

list all: 14s
list all, just 'id' field: 14s
list one: 0.6s
list one, just 'id' field: 0.6s

With just the previous partial fix:

list all: 14s
list all, just 'id' field: 6s
list one: 0.6s
list one, just 'id' field: 0.2s

Now with this change:

list all: 14s
list all, just 'id' field: 0.04s
list one: 0.6s
list one, just 'id' field: 0.03s

Change-Id: Id6870633e3943666e9b7fb900ad2d0894ee2715d
(cherry picked from commit 1d41f39ddf23b131a8960ac718ed9f8f015f3702)
(squashed Change-Id: I15df276ba7dbcb3763ab20b63b26cddf2d594954)

commit_message:
Fix slow SG api calls when limiting fields

Relating to the issue with creating rules, when reading security
groups, it is very slow. Even when limiting to id/name, it pulls
in all rules before returning just id/name.

This change looks at the fields requested, and if no "synthetic"
fields are in the list, skips initializing those.

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu<hongbin.lu@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1810563
Change-Id: Id6870633e3943666e9b7fb900ad2d0894ee2715d

after completion of initial sync with server.

commit_message:
Re-propose volume backed server rebuild

The spec for support rebuild volume backed
server was accepted in Stein, but some of
the work did not finish, so repropose it
for Train.

Co-Authored-By: ramboman <lijie@unitedstack.com>
blueprint volume-backed-server-rebuild

commit_message:
ipmi: Ignore sensor debug data

When the conductor has debugging enabled, that command is
passed to ipmitool to enable debugging of other commands.

However, this means tons of extra data is dumped as part of
the sensor data collection for ironic, which breaks string
parsing and ultimately metrics collection.

Since we can identify these lines, lets ignore them.

Change-Id: Ife77707210f8289d8f2e0223fb9ee1909d798546
Story: 2005332
Task: 30267
(cherry picked from commit 418a5668a4c947326f28cf13e962e914ebadc012)

commit_message:
ipmi: Ignore sensor debug data

When the conductor has debugging enabled, that command is
passed to ipmitool to enable debugging of other commands.

However, this means tons of extra data is dumped as part of
the sensor data collection for ironic, which breaks string
parsing and ultimately metrics collection.

Since we can identify these lines, lets ignore them.

Change-Id: Ife77707210f8289d8f2e0223fb9ee1909d798546
Story: 2005332
Task: 30267
(cherry picked from commit 418a5668a4c947326f28cf13e962e914ebadc012)

Change-Id: Ie132389a21ed74cec4e7e22ecdcb9254964b9d3c
'}, {'created': '2019-04-02 09:39:31.000000000', 'message': 'Use full branch name as build_image.sh argument

`build_image.sh` expects full branch name as argument like e.g.
`stable/stein`. This change fixes Zuul playbook to pass the right
argument.

commit_message:
Use full branch name as build_image.sh argument

`build_image.sh` expects full branch name as argument like e.g.
`stable/stein`. This change fixes Zuul playbook to pass the right
argument.

Change-Id: Ie132389a21ed74cec4e7e22ecdcb9254964b9d3c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-01 16:22:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix amp failover where failover already failed

If a failover ran on an amphora and was unsuccessful and reverted, it
would mark the amp status "DELETED" and un-busy the health record.
It would then be picked up on the next failover check, start failing
over, and break early since it appeared to be "unallocated".

Also, housekeeping can now clean up expired amphora records based on the
amphora's updated_at time instead of the health record's time, which
means the records won't be immediately cleaned up anymore after they go
through failover flows.

Change-Id: I848b7fc69b977fcb39f8a07e2ea5fc7bd37b5c7a

commit_message:
Fix amp failover where failover already failed

If a failover ran on an amphora and was unsuccessful and reverted, it
would mark the amp status "DELETED" and un-busy the health record.
It would then be picked up on the next failover check, start failing
over, and break early since it appeared to be "unallocated".

Also, housekeeping can now clean up expired amphora records based on the
amphora's updated_at time instead of the health record's time, which
means the records won't be immediately cleaned up anymore after they go
through failover flows.

Change-Id: I848b7fc69b977fcb39f8a07e2ea5fc7bd37b5c7a

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9845abdd6577267e2f3abaf1f57cf8731a66c733

commit_message:
Use full branch name as build_image.sh argument

`build_image.sh` expects full branch name as argument like e.g.
`stable/stein`. This change fixes Zuul playbook to pass the right
argument.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649538
Change-Id: Ie132389a21ed74cec4e7e22ecdcb9254964b9d3c

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic1942cf652b8488aefc0061696f68bcc986f53eb

commit_message:
Adds NTP sync process to account for ceph time sync requirements.
Removes precheck portion of NTP.
Corrects for redhat
Fixes typo

Change-Id: Ic8d2cd3c2ba02f9f672db862a74950dc73753f2d
Closes-Bug: #1700121

commit_message:
Add kolla variable to config kibana node.js

Variable kibana_nodejs_options contain command line options for kibana
node.js server. One of use cases is set process memory footprint by
--max_old_space_size

Change-Id: I24d79c32d7ca67e3b2e5dd617f7361acee4a4d16

subject: Change the kibana retry  number
messages:
[{'account_id': 26576, 'date': '2017-11-01 09:57:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8157, 'date': '2017-11-02 07:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26576, 'date': '2017-11-02 07:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26576, 'date': '2017-11-02 07:42:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (2 comments)

Ok,i changed it.Thank you very much.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2017-11-02 08:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I would prefer to analyse the RCA and not to increase the number of retries. Why do you need more than 5 restarts to be able to use Kibana?'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-11-08 08:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

agree with Christian, the retry limit is maybe a workload issue in the host, kibana usually does not take that long to start the service.

I would prefer a analysis to define why to use 10 rather than 5'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-12-13 17:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add config template changes to support Ironic

Add changes specifically to support the Pike release of Ironic,
which introduced a new type of config option for the driver support
matrix.

Reference:
https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/pike/install/enabling-drivers.html

Change-Id: I5286aa4b71b72e5477b4d58e0347de446f4a7dac

subject: Remove checking m1.tiny flavor
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1390, 'name': 'Paul Bourke', 'email': 'pauldbourke@proton.me', 'username': 'pauldbourke'}, {'_account_id': 7488, 'name': 'Jeffrey Zhang', 'email': 'zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com', 'username': 'Jeffrey4l'}, {'_account_id': 11105, 'name': 'Swapnil Kulkarni', 'email': 'coolsvap@gmail.com', 'username': 'coolsvap'}, {'_account_id': 18494, 'name': 'Ravi Shekhar Jethani', 'email': 'rsjethani@gmail.com', 'username': 'rsjethani'}, {'_account_id': 19316, 'name': 'Eduardo Gonzalez', 'email': 'dabarren@gmail.com', 'username': 'egonzalez90'}, {'_account_id': 22165, 'name': 'caoyuan', 'email': 'cao.yingjunz@gmail.com', 'username': 'caoyuan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 18494, 'date': '2017-11-22 11:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-11-22 13:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

In my opinion is safer check and create rather than ignore errors'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-11-22 14:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The script is "run once" by nature, so I think this patch is fine. If anything we should remove the > /dev/null'}, {'account_id': 18494, 'date': '2017-11-22 15:22:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree with Paul here. Also even if we use the check it is _incomplete_. For instance if somehow m1.tiny flavor does exists then the script will not create other flavors. So either we write a complete check for every flavor or simply ignore errors while creating an existing flavor. IMO latter case is simpler'}, {'account_id': 18494, 'date': '2017-11-22 15:29:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18494, 'date': '2017-11-22 15:35:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

OOPS!! wanted to use 2> in the first place somehow ended up using >. Jet lag i guess :(, fixed in PS#2'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-11-22 15:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-11-22 15:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18494, 'date': '2017-11-22 17:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-11-23 07:04:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18494, 'date': '2017-11-23 11:01:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Eduardo got it!!! so this actually makes flavor checking more redundant. I would take your suggestion to remove '2>/dev/null' hoping user won't mind one line error message(which he would only see if not running the script on a new setup). PS3 coming..."}, {'account_id': 18494, 'date': '2017-11-23 11:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-11-24 08:21:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

better ansiblized this shell file ;('}, {'account_id': 18494, 'date': '2017-11-25 16:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Jeffrey well that would be the ideal solution(will be proposing on mailing list) but that would require significant change. In the meantime IMO fixing this script might do.'}, {'account_id': 11105, 'date': '2017-11-27 05:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Since we are not blocked without this change. As an improvement, I think we can propose to ansiblize the script IMHO. Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2017-12-02 03:31:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

ignore the errors is not a good ideas for, but ansiblize the init is good idea just like Jeffrey say,
please review the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523072/'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-08 09:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Very old'}]

commit_message:
Remove checking m1.tiny flavor

Instead of checking whether m1.tiny flavor exists simply
create the default flavors and ignore errors if a flavor
already exists.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I573b90b354b93ebf81eaa4f5df0a614a9b99a24b

commit_message:
Revert "Use Stein release for all OpenStack projects"

This reverts commit 61d42b5a00875290ebeb24ac2faab4af566b7796.

Switch back to master branch of dependencies on master now we have
branched stable/stein.

Change-Id: I16fc621fc5a8879eeb9e00edf068d0d124969d16

commit_message:
Modify the instructions for setting up vip.

Whether it is all-in-one or multinode, as long as no need high-availability
should be set that.

Change-Id: I53356b5e784a37cd6bda24ee48bff9cb7ecccf17

commit_message:
Fix Ansible WARNING logs on reserved name: action

When using kolla-ansible the following log is always display:

[WARNING]: Found variable using reserved name: action

As describe in https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.3/playbooks_directives.html
"action" keywork is reserved for Task.

Hence playbook input variable named 'action' is replaced by 'method'.

Closes-Bug: #1724854
Change-Id: I7afc3d7d80a55ef9dc05f97f9f04e81e5b588be1

commit_message:
Fix configuration in the all.yml

When you delpoy openstack ha, you can enable "keepalived".
This modification also update the "opendaylight.tar".

Change-Id: I030a1a04f5b4ac124fcae3be8b80d7bb13367684

[{'created': '2017-10-13 10:17:57.000000000', 'message': "Cannot deploy controller without tunnel_interface

It looks like all.yml variables are evaluated before going into
templates and therefore we cannot skip them with template's
if-endif blocks. tunnel_interface_address is set in all.yml and
is evaluated for ml2_conf.ini.j2 before we parse the template and
decide whether it is needed on controllers or not.

Change-Id: Ia936ebb11485dd2c695dcb27bd1600b2a2801e13
Closes-Bug: #1723124
"}]
commit_message:
Cannot deploy controller without tunnel_interface

It looks like all.yml variables are evaluated before going into
templates and therefore we cannot skip them with template's
if-endif blocks. tunnel_interface_address is set in all.yml and
is evaluated for ml2_conf.ini.j2 before we parse the template and
decide whether it is needed on controllers or not.

Change-Id: Ia936ebb11485dd2c695dcb27bd1600b2a2801e13
Closes-Bug: #1723124

subject: Add cinder-volume host configuration to support HA
messages:
[{'account_id': 17478, 'date': '2017-10-09 13:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-10-09 13:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-10-09 13:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-10-09 13:40:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (6 comments)

Hi Eduardo, as you mentioned we need Pacemaker for a correct active/passive Cinder implementation with shared storage. Right now Kolla doesn't do this - this patch is a first step towards that.

As I understand it, when using any shared storage backend (i.e. not LVM), we need two things:

1) Host names the same across all cinder-volume services (this patch)
2) One active cinder-volume or pacemaker to control them automatically (in progress)"}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-10-09 13:43:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-10-09 13:45:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Yeah, agree with that, however ceph by design works in active/active and can have diff hostnames. lvm, nfs, (maybe fujitsu no idea about it) will need same hostname, but I prefer first have a pacemaker implementation before changing this. Dont know what upgrade consequences may have'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-10-09 13:49:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Sounds reasonable Eduardo, thanks for the input. Will set WIP for now'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-10-09 14:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-09 15:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

(1 comment)

Is this true? If yes I do not understand the "cluster" parameter

# Name of this cluster.  Used to group volume hosts that share the same backend
# configurations to work in HA Active-Active mode.  Active-Active is not yet
# supported. (string value)
#cluster = <None>'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2017-10-10 05:04:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If it is necessary to have the same hostname for a specific backend I think it is better to use backend_host in the specific backend section.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-08 09:26:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Very old'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-09 13:21:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add cinder-volume host configuration to support HA

 - Set the same hostname for cinder backends
   when not using LVM.

   cinder-volume needs an additional option for drivers to
   configure their host names when using HA.

   Ref: https://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/storage-ha-block.html

   Change-Id: Ica8d0938142d997e63bfea6c6906a88a8b7286aa

Change-Id: Ief7e94b82e272d80a48929245e06a8d6f3c26154
'}, {'created': '2017-10-09 13:30:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add cinder-volume host configuration to support HA

When using shared storage backends for Cinder, the hostname should be
same for all volume services [0]

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/storage-ha-block.html#configure-block-storage-api-service

Change-Id: Ica8d0938142d997e63bfea6c6906a88a8b7286aa
'}, {'created': '2017-10-09 13:43:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add cinder-volume host configuration to support HA

When using shared storage backends for Cinder, the hostname should be
same for all volume services [0]

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/storage-ha-block.html#configure-block-storage-api-service

Partial-Bug: #1716909
Co-Authored-By: Paul Bourke <paul.bourke@oracle.com>
Change-Id: Ica8d0938142d997e63bfea6c6906a88a8b7286aa
'}]
commit_message:
Add cinder-volume host configuration to support HA

When using shared storage backends for Cinder, the hostname should be
same for all volume services [0]

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/storage-ha-block.html#configure-block-storage-api-service

Partial-Bug: #1716909
Co-Authored-By: Paul Bourke <paul.bourke@oracle.com>
Change-Id: Ica8d0938142d997e63bfea6c6906a88a8b7286aa

commit_message:
Remove redundant trove.conf for trove services

Trove-taskmanager and trove-conductor do not need trove.conf.

Change-Id: Id7b5af140ba6569c59f22b8e9f7a2769345b4b0d

WIP: Document release process

This document adds a sample release process
for the knowledge of new release liasons or
just for fun. It is not intended to be executed
by anyone, just for knowledge.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-20 19:52:37.000000000', 'message': "Turn off galera in aio

For devmode, if you just shutdown aio (turn of laptop for example),
galera will still assume full shutdown and you'll have to go through
manual steps to restart it.

Change-Id: I44631f6f2a04ee64b9fcb9cb2cb5d9353f23deb3
"}]
commit_message:
Turn off galera in aio

For devmode, if you just shutdown aio (turn of laptop for example),
galera will still assume full shutdown and you'll have to go through
manual steps to restart it.

Change-Id: I44631f6f2a04ee64b9fcb9cb2cb5d9353f23deb3

commit_message:
Update catalog endpoints to use $(project_id)s

Use of $(tenant_id)s is deprecated and catalog endpoints should be
updated to use $(project_id)s.

See link below:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/catalog_project_id-519f5a70f9f7c4c6.yaml#L10

Change-Id: Ia95c83324f2e12bb4bcfbe62555e7a8a00c6816d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-25 02:32:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the task about --limit does not perform

This task "Gather facts for all hosts (if using --limit)" is not
executed when the --limit parameter is added. Need to add
"tag: always" to solve this bug.
Closes-bug: #1711266

Change-Id: I4cda0454e1172518a372ebb91875ad437dc64c0c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the task about --limit does not perform

This task "Gather facts for all hosts (if using --limit)" is not
executed when the --limit parameter is added. Need to add
"tag: always" to solve this bug.
Closes-bug: #1711266

Change-Id: I4cda0454e1172518a372ebb91875ad437dc64c0c

commit_message:
[WIP] POC of buffering layer for Neutron

The buffering layer is trying to eliminate downtime when upgrading Neutron.
As demo in [1].

[1] https://www.openstack.org/videos/boston-2017/openstack-cluster-zero-downtime-upgrade-with-kolla

Depends-On: I7a8d2fc64b037196ce3e52e7dc4f26bdb844a89b

Will broke the whole deployment.
api_interface_address will use  correct interface name, but other api-interface IP  address wont be able to find the interface.

If there is dash in api_interface name then it is not working at all. It can't broke deployment more. We hit this issue for tunnel_interface. So correction works for tunnel_interface.
Handling for api_interface was corrected only in affected files.  If there is no dash in interface name then it is working as before.

I'm leaving for next two weeks. So, I won't react to next comments within that time."}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-08-21 19:26:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-21 09:58:01.000000000', 'message': 'Use ansible fact for interface containing dash

tunnel_interface_address is not assigned in case that
tunnel_interface name contain dash.
Ansible facts name do not match interface name containing dash.
Ansible fact name is generated from interface name where all
dashes are replaced with underscores.

Current fix replace dashes in interface name with underscore
before searching for coresponding ansibe fact

Change-Id: I798cad75ada1bed763a4504d0ca5a4bfd315c2e9
Closes-Bug: #1711757
'}]
commit_message:
Use ansible fact for interface containing dash

tunnel_interface_address is not assigned in case that
tunnel_interface name contain dash.
Ansible facts name do not match interface name containing dash.
Ansible fact name is generated from interface name where all
dashes are replaced with underscores.

Current fix replace dashes in interface name with underscore
before searching for coresponding ansibe fact

Change-Id: I798cad75ada1bed763a4504d0ca5a4bfd315c2e9
Closes-Bug: #1711757

commit_message:
Add OSIC Scale Testing Documentation

The expectation here is that folks working on the OSIC scale
testing will collaborate on this document and edit it as they
finish up the work they volunteered for.  Once the work is
finished and the four weeks have elapsed, we will publish this
via the normal docs.oo website.

Co-Authored-By: Paul Bourke <paul.bourke@oracle.com>
Co-Authored-By: Swapnil Kulkarni (coolsvap) <me@coolsvap.net>
Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I9f7a883a93e6a4e3f17479bd1529aaf72e5b9c2d

commit_message:
Fingerprint containers.

This PS is an initial exploratory implementation of container
fingerprinting to discover how often the containers actually
change.

Change-Id: I4481f45bb9901d7167a74a298b9fa8d0c796fcb9

I think this is a good idea but we need more concrete explanation of how it will work. Mainly, how will kolla-ansible access the new config location? Also need more detail around what "removing ansible specific vars" will look like.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2016-11-30 00:36:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think this is useful, as I'd like to be able to use the config files without *necessarily* requiring ansible or k8s."}, {'account_id': 10787, 'date': '2016-11-30 20:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2016-12-02 17:20:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

This is a good start.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2016-12-10 17:49:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think centralizing the config like this is a bad idea. This assumes that all deploy projects using kolla will use jinja2 and ansible to template.

This makes a weird dependency that has some subtle caveats for installing kolla-ansible since kolla-ansible needs kolla to work, but a change in a config might require a change in config files which now exist in kolla. And that might affect all kolla-* projects if they depend on those configs.

I feel very strongly against this since it puts a requirement to use ansible to use configs that exist in the kolla main repo. It is weird.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2016-12-10 18:29:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

kfox and I had a conversation on the IRCs about this. To summarize:

Kevin thinks this will be less work than maintaining configs for kolla-ansible and kolla-kubernetes separate. I disagree because this adds its own complexity and raises the bar to understand _either_ project. Additionally, we are now binding deployment projects back to the kolla repo which was _just_ separated.

We did agree on one thing, these templates are just references. Should another kolla-* project come along, these would not be _required_ to be used. They can be used should that project choose too. If everyone else agrees on that, then ok. I still think this will cause both kolla-ansible and kolla-k8s more trouble than its worth though.

For the record, when I went through all configs in the Liberty->Mitaka config refresh i did for b3 it took me 2 hours for _all_ of them. The mere fact that this affects gating (a change in kolla repo _configs_ breaks kolla-ansible or kolla-k8s) means this will take far more dev time to try to implement that it will save long term in my opinion.

And for what its worth, not having templates in the template folder in ansible is going against best practices. The ansible code is literally hard-coded to check there for templates. It also prevents any hope of allowing kolla-ansible to rework into ansible galaxy which is a shame.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2016-12-11 00:24:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Though this solves some immediate issue, as it removed the current dependency that kolla-k8s has on kolla-ansible I'm not sure this is the best approach long term. I believe that networking differences (as an obvious example) between ansible and k8s deployment are likely to make shared config difficult in the long term without resulting in a system that is not optimal for either use case and suffers from significant complexity. As some other commenters have implied the result would be general OpenStack configuration tool - which has an incredibly broad scope, and is very indicative of the amount of work, and complexity, that maintaining a common configuration library would entail."}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2016-12-16 03:09:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> (5 comments)
 > 
 > This is a good start.'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2017-03-09 10:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Dear Michal,
Seems like, we are not following this. Please update, otherwise abandon if not needed.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-03-27 19:48:47.000000000', 'content': 'Removed the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Sam Yaple <sam@yaple.net>
'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2017-04-15 19:03:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Michal,

Since you ultimately went a different way, I think this spec served as a good point of discussion, but can now be abandoned.

Regards
-steve'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-08 09:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

2 years old'}]

commit_message:
Move config templates to Kolla spec

To allow easier reusability of our config files across orchiestration
engines, let's move them to Kolla.

Change-Id: Id31a08932e9ef5d9b1b96cb9cc0bba754fde7826
Partially-implements: blueprint config-in-kolla

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2016-06-18 00:38:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There is some confusion I see in the reviewer's comments in this review over exactly what Kolla's mission statement is:

Kolla provides production-ready containers and deployment tools for
operating OpenStack clouds.

Key words:

"Provides"
"Production Ready"
"Containers and Deployment tools"
"Operating"
"OpenStack clouds"

Kolla's mission was defined two years ago and the entire project has been shaped by it.  When people invest time in a project, they typically look at the mission statement first to make sure it matches with their personal objectives.  Anything in this spec that doesn't facilitate Kolla's mission requires close inspection to properly serve our community.

The following individuals [1] have invested their time over the last 365 days.  If we violate our mission statement, we would be responsible for letting down the 300+ individuals that have contributed in some way to Kolla over the last year and potentially cratering the project in the process.

[1] http://stackalytics.com/report/contribution/kolla-group/365'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2016-06-20 09:53:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

It's just not clear to me what you need here, or what problem you're looking to solve."}, {'account_id': 10787, 'date': '2016-06-20 16:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2016-06-21 09:25:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

i like the idea for universal containers. But not a fan to the one
repository for one openstack component. I do not see the benefit to
do so.'}, {'account_id': 11105, 'date': '2016-06-21 09:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Proposal spec for universal containers

This is a meta specification to discuss potential direction for Kolla to
provide universal deployment tool agnostic OpenStack containers in a

subject: Expose the ARGS parameter in the start.sh
messages:
[{'account_id': 7693, 'date': '2015-12-17 22:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2015-12-17 22:28:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

ARGS is not supposed to be accessible via the deployment tool, it was meant to be only for the extend_start.sh script. Having some cases where setting ARGS works and doesnt isn't acceptable in my opinion (some container override ARGS, some do not). The accepted method of doing this is to update the command.json file with the new args you want to use.

I understand this change as it relates to your galera patch, but I do not agree with this change for the reasons stated above. This patchset can serve as a talking point for this issue for the rest of the community.

Additionally you have not wishlist item or blueprint"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-12-18 00:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

[{'created': '2015-12-17 22:07:42.000000000', 'message': 'Expose the ARGS parameter in the start.sh

Currently, we mask the ARGS parameter in a way, that it can only
be set inside the image via the extended start script. Thus the
prominent way to change this ARGS is to re-build the image.
This change, now exposes the ARGS parameter to take its default
value from the environment variable ARGS. Thus giving us option
to set the value from ansible. Howeever, setting the value from
inside the image will take precedence over the environment
variable.

Change-Id: Ifed17a56f54c874c316630a3f245a85dcc5abba0
'}]
commit_message:
Expose the ARGS parameter in the start.sh

Currently, we mask the ARGS parameter in a way, that it can only
be set inside the image via the extended start script. Thus the
prominent way to change this ARGS is to re-build the image.
This change, now exposes the ARGS parameter to take its default
value from the environment variable ARGS. Thus giving us option
to set the value from ansible. Howeever, setting the value from
inside the image will take precedence over the environment
variable.

Change-Id: Ifed17a56f54c874c316630a3f245a85dcc5abba0

Nova-ssh is used via the remotefs calls in nova.  This method implements
bascially 4 commands.  To limit the security risk of allowing
password-less ssh access between compute nodes for remotefs puproses we
should do sanity checking of the commands that are coming though ssh.

authorized key, as well as forcing only the remote_fs.sh shell script
to be ran. This script is added in kolla via:

commit_message:
Add some sanity to nova_ssh allowed commands

Nova-ssh is used via the remotefs calls in nova.  This method implements
bascially 4 commands.  To limit the security risk of allowing
password-less ssh access between compute nodes for remotefs puproses we
should do sanity checking of the commands that are coming though ssh.

Prevent some un-needed ssh features from being allowed in with the
authorized key, as well as forcing only the remote_fs.sh shell script
to be ran.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649477
Change-Id: I05488a2a17d8773cb3944813f65cac40bc6f9595

commit_message:
Bump psycopg2 lowest version

There is a bug in 2.6 line of psycopg2 that does not properly detect
Postgresql 10 versions.

https://github.com/psycopg/psycopg2/issues/489

Change-Id: If5f773fb9e1ee2cb4e3fff71cd65539caa065e10

subject: Use recommended twine check for README validation
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-05 16:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-04-06 19:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-04-08 08:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-05 16:00:46.000000000', 'message': 'Use recommended twine check for README validation

The use of ``python setup.py check -r -s`` is actually deprecated and
the recommended method for validating a README for PyPi upload is to
build the sdist and wheel and run ``twine check $DIST_PATH``. This
switches our validation check to use the supported method.

Change-Id: I321b8cf6f1e2116d2fe23059d5f13aa6f2ae8b4c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use recommended twine check for README validation

The use of ``python setup.py check -r -s`` is actually deprecated and
the recommended method for validating a README for PyPi upload is to
build the sdist and wheel and run ``twine check $DIST_PATH``. This
switches our validation check to use the supported method.

Change-Id: I321b8cf6f1e2116d2fe23059d5f13aa6f2ae8b4c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Extend default datasources settings

Add ability to configure such datasources like:
* static (VITRAGE_USE_STATIC)
* doctor (VITRAGE_USE_DOCTOR)
* prometheus (VITRAGE_USE_PROMETHEUS)

All these datasources are disabled now by default.

Change-Id: I60b2810defbd5d2ce63a6408ed5a835efd7c6904

commit_message:
Build docker images in Zuul

Add dummy script `build_image.sh` in docker top folder for building both
depended images to avoid adding special case in Zuul build job.

Small fixes to docker README.

Story: 2001694
Task: 28223
Change-Id: I386bc286de702a1bead0bf8e0e80fe0b3c73a9bf

subject: FWaaS v1->v2 DB migration
messages:
[{'account_id': 20363, 'date': '2019-02-07 07:01:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2019-02-20 10:26:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-03-07 12:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2019-03-08 11:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hello Akihiro,

As you understand a user might want to migrate and keep control over the process before the FWaaS v1 code is dropped in Stein. 
I completely get your point that the migration can be easily be executed from another host, without the need for having this code in the rocky branch.

The purpose of this patch was to ensure a user could have a chance of performing this migration having the code for the migration available in the repository.

I agree however that this violates processes since the migration script is tantamount to a DB migration.'}, {'account_id': 20363, 'date': '2019-04-08 08:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 07:01:52.000000000', 'message': 'FWaaS v1->v2 DB migration

FWaaS V1 was deleted in Stein.
This patch cherry picks the V1->V2 migration to Rocky, as it make sense to allow users
to migrate before the upgrade.

Run this tool using: neutron-fwaas-migrate-v1-to-v2 --neutron-db-connection=<neutron database connection string>

Change-Id: I663c173a594137056c96ad4c4b60e810059fb6fa
'}]
commit_message:
FWaaS v1->v2 DB migration

FWaaS V1 was deleted in Stein.
This patch cherry picks the V1->V2 migration to Rocky, as it make sense to allow users
to migrate before the upgrade.

Run this tool using: neutron-fwaas-migrate-v1-to-v2 --neutron-db-connection=<neutron database connection string>

Change-Id: I663c173a594137056c96ad4c4b60e810059fb6fa

commit_message:
Use "push" flag for buildah

The push=False flag with use with kolla-build.conf is not working if we
use buildah, clear example is the
tripleo-build-containers-centos-7-buildah job, it's suppose to work like
docker one but it's pushing too.

Closes-Bug: #1822752

Change-Id: I01788b3c11ac701b2cf8c151f95ccad7046532de

commit_message:
[k8s] Set traefik to stable version v1.7.9

The current magnum traefik deployment will always pull latest traefik
container image. With the new launch of traefik v2
(https://blog.containo.us/back-to-traefik-2-0-2f9aa17be305) this will
have impact on how the ingress is described in k8s.

This patch:
* Sets the traefik version to default tag v1.7.9, stable release
prior to v2.
* Adds a new label <ingress_controller_tag> to enable the user
to specify other than default currently in use ingress controller
container release.

Task: 30143
Task: 30146
Story: 2005286

Change-Id: I98cce01d2eca8525875894426d45d365b2ecc7db
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[k8s] Set traefik to stable version v1.7.9

The current magnum traefik deployment will always pull latest traefik
container image. With the new launch of traefik v2
(https://blog.containo.us/back-to-traefik-2-0-2f9aa17be305) this will
have impact on how the ingress is described in k8s.

This patch:
* Sets the traefik version to default tag v1.7.9, stable release
prior to v2.
* Adds a new label <ingress_controller_tag> to enable the user
to specify other than default currently in use ingress controller
container release.

Task: 30143
Task: 30146
Story: 2005286

Change-Id: I1034e76f1d0619183dfa3f310d9e37c7f2c042e4
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2019-04-06 03:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2019-04-08 06:46:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-06 03:56:36.000000000', 'message': "Detect missing metric_id before passing through bytearray()

It is possible for a row in Cassandra to have a missing metric_id
(shows as 'null' in cqlsh).  This causes an ugly NoneType error
to be passed up to the user on the command line for
'monaca metric-list'.

Fix is to detect the missing value, log an error, and return the
row with None for the metric_id.

Change-Id: Ie617932c6b12a6cfe441510e120bb77a3470b9cf
Story: 2005305
Task: 30194
(cherry picked from commit d6852ee1b7d548321af104f2a0e4be523a49ed08)
"}]
commit_message:
Detect missing metric_id before passing through bytearray()

It is possible for a row in Cassandra to have a missing metric_id
(shows as 'null' in cqlsh).  This causes an ugly NoneType error
to be passed up to the user on the command line for
'monaca metric-list'.

Fix is to detect the missing value, log an error, and return the
row with None for the metric_id.

Change-Id: Ie617932c6b12a6cfe441510e120bb77a3470b9cf
Story: 2005305
Task: 30194
(cherry picked from commit d6852ee1b7d548321af104f2a0e4be523a49ed08)

commit_message:
Add support for text ports on Network Policy Spec

This commit adds support for Network Policies that define ports with text
in the ingress or egress section. It checks if the containers
in pods have their ports with the same name as the port defined in the
Network Policy. In the case when the policy is applied over namespace(s),
the pods in that namespace(s) have their containers checked and if matched
a SG rule with a new 'remote_ip_prefixes' pointing to that pod(s) is
created.

Change-Id: I8d4a8b037d7dd48bcec6a549c1cebeb2e71ab96f
Closes-Bug: 1818983

Load balancers were going in to ERROR when updating vip_qos_policy_id in
two different cases:

- QoS extension enabled: the VIP DB data model was incorrectly
  constructed ('vip_qos_policy_id' where it should have been
  'qos_policy_id')
- QoS extension disabled: setting an UUID or None would fail in the LB
  update flow as the extension is disabled, and the API would return

"}]
commit_message:
Fix setting of VIP QoS policy

Load balancers were going in to ERROR when updating vip_qos_policy_id in
two different cases:

- QoS extension enabled: the VIP DB data model was incorrectly
  constructed ('vip_qos_policy_id' where it should have been
  'qos_policy_id')
- QoS extension disabled: setting an UUID or None would fail in the LB
  update flow as the extension is disabled, and the API would return
  HTTP 202 to the user.

Conflicts:
    octavia/api/v2/controllers/load_balancer.py
    octavia/tests/unit/api/drivers/amphora_driver/test_amphora_driver.py

Story: 2004602
Task: 28512

Change-Id: Ie974afa52fe70cbab72b7e7f75bf7ee1015e148c
(cherry picked from commit e0c45ce4d288aa0a8c855754245cd3949e54fa3d)
(cherry picked from commit 86e3eb4cab9610e15cc67381908b3619134d2909)
(cherry picked from commit 4d9b818b73e256645c3964e311c225f12f3aa0ea)

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie4c0c040e4471648431554448b55cdc6ce2261ab

commit_message:
Modified the completion condition of evacuate

The completion conditions of evacuate are the following.
  - old_vm_state=active, new_vm_state=active
  - old_vm_state=stopped, new_vm_state=stopped
  - old_vm_state=error, new_vm_state=active

"old_vm_state=error, new_vm_state=error" is not completion
of evacuate. So this patch modified this completion condition
of evacuate.

Change-Id: I8ccc857fe0794a49f993fe55c2262a04d0f72ad0
Closes-Bug: #1782516

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-collect-logs project to tripleo

ansible-role-collect-logs is a new tripleo log collection ansible
role seperated from tripleo-quickstart-extras project for reusing
it with other projects.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/647667/

Change-Id: I4f2b541b43cb4eadf04778bb93ae97fc3248e5d0
