commit_message:
PCI: do not force remove allocated devices

In the ocata release the pci_passthrough_whitelist
was moved from the [DEFAULT] section of the nova.conf
to the [pci] section and renamed to passthrough_whitelist.

On upgrading if the operator chooses to migrate the config
value to the new section it is not uncommon
to forget to rename the config value.
Similarly if an operator is updateing the whitelist and
mistypes the value it can also lead to the whitelist
being ignored.

As a result of either error the nova compute agent
would delete all database entries for a host regardless of
if the pci device was in use by an instance. If this occurs
the only recorse for an operator is to delete and recreate
the guest on that host after correcting the error or manually
restore the database to backup or otherwise consistent state.

This change alters the _set_hvdevs function to not force
remove allocated or claimed devices if they are no longer
present in the pci whitelist.

Conflicts:
  nova/pci/manager.py

Closes-Bug: #1633120
Change-Id: I6e871311a0fa10beaf601ca6912b4a33ba4094e0
(cherry picked from commit 26c41eccade6412f61f9a8721d853b545061adcc)

The fix seems fine, although I do have to ask if there's a good reason to allow it to be < 60 seconds?"}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2017-06-03 14:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

One thing that might be a good add; see inline'}, {'account_id': 24042, 'date': '2017-06-04 17:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

"The fix seems fine, although I do have to ask if there's a good reason to allow it to be < 60 seconds?"

Yes:
"periodic_interval = 60 	(Integer) Interval, in seconds, between running periodic tasks"
https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/block-storage/config-options.html

If we offer configuration parameters to administrators, then we either need to document that the minimum interval here is 60 seconds (documentation bug) or we need to make the system behavior consistent with the parameters. 

In a specific use case, we wanted cinder to update its knowledge of the current storage backend's remaining size more often due to very fast creation of vaolumes on the storage backend (I did not run into this issue nor work on it, it only was brought to my attention then that the periodic_interval parameter did not update the periodic task runs to anything less than 60 seconds)'}, {'account_id': 15831, 'date': '2017-06-05 01:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This could be a followup (or possibly in the release notes, or both).  I believe that generating statistics is very expensive for some of the backends, so setting this value too low might impact some installations.  It might be a good idea to mention that in the config option help text [0] so operators would be on the alert if they adjust the value.  Right now the text says "Interval, in seconds, between running periodic tasks" which doesn't make it obvious what could be affected.

commit_message:
Enable service capabilities update at less than 60 seconds

periodic_interval only works at a minimum of 60 seconds
for periodic_tasks that update service capabilities
Make it possible for service capabilities updates to run
at intervals < 60 seconds as defined in parameter
periodic_interval in cinder.conf

Change-Id: I0f78aa7dc04dc0d74fed7c2c84d3442f2993258d
Closes-Bug: #1695018

commit_message:
Mock OVSBrdge.clear_minimum_bandwidth_qos in fullstack tests

This function will not be executed when the OVS agent is started,
in order to keep QoS and Queue registers in OVS BD created by other
tests.

Change-Id: I054510403a4f46544ff78ee2f6babb1247726553
Closes-Bug: #1819125
(cherry picked from commit 531fdc336b1b6b74de1b148b0dfe9eebd9e5cdc3)

commit_message:
Remove packaging

This isn't distributed and can't be (there's not package to distribute).
We can remove this.

The Python-based zuul jobs are removed since there's no Python package
here.

Change-Id: Icff0aed6cd9f136ceefd6f8f0386cabe97bbf3fb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: fix latest_tag to be more python3 friendly

With the switch of running documentation jobs on Python 3, the code
we had to get the latest tag doesn't work well.  We didn't catch
this because this branch of code only ran inside non-latest series
so once we branched Stein.

Change-Id: Ie6b62c5c4ffd566e9661449faa36bf44efb8aa39
(cherry picked from commit 4929127ede23025f6f686ac9e8f9606a42bf6b6e)

commit_message:
docs: fix latest_tag to be more python3 friendly

With the switch of running documentation jobs on Python 3, the code
we had to get the latest tag doesn't work well.  We didn't catch
this because this branch of code only ran inside non-latest series
so once we branched Stein.

Change-Id: Ie6b62c5c4ffd566e9661449faa36bf44efb8aa39

commit_message:
Add rootwrap filters to kill state change monitor

When deleting HA routers, the keepalived state change monitor has to be
deleted. This patch adds rootwrap filters to allow deleting the state
change monitor.

Change-Id: Icfb208d9b51eaa41cf01af81f1ede7420a19cc93
Partial-Bug: #1795870
Partial-Bug: #1789434
(cherry picked from commit 25c432a05a57f794dcbb4f17ce224d914c65e071)
(cherry picked from commit 6f3620aa88feef9527f8c9599dec049a831b49fa)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-05 15:17:23.000000000', 'message': 'Format generated MAC addresses using eui48.mac_unix_expanded

In Ml2Plugin.create_port_bulk, the MAC generated using netaddr.EUI
have the following format:
  "XX-XX-XX-XX-XX-XX"

In order to make them more compatible with other systems, the
following format is more appropiate:
  "00:01:23:45:67:ab"

eui48.mac_unix_expanded formater will add leading zeros if needed.

Change-Id: Ice382c0b4738a5a2576a3a4b151059715f106b40
Closes-Bug: #1822999
(cherry picked from commit fa5e9c6fabb8e3f2e16646a87ca29c754e7f8c7a)
'}]
commit_message:
Format generated MAC addresses using eui48.mac_unix_expanded

In Ml2Plugin.create_port_bulk, the MAC generated using netaddr.EUI
have the following format:
  "XX-XX-XX-XX-XX-XX"

In order to make them more compatible with other systems, the
following format is more appropiate:
  "00:01:23:45:67:ab"

eui48.mac_unix_expanded formater will add leading zeros if needed.

Change-Id: Ice382c0b4738a5a2576a3a4b151059715f106b40
Closes-Bug: #1822999
(cherry picked from commit fa5e9c6fabb8e3f2e16646a87ca29c754e7f8c7a)

commit_message:
DNM & WIP: Add yamllint against */values.yaml

This patch set adds yamllinting against all the */values.yaml files.

TODO:
1. fix all the problems in value.yaml so the linter passes
2. reenable all the jobs disabled in .zuul.yaml

Change-Id: I0c59fd39e875bc1abdcea6ca54b2fae7aecbcb62
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Add nova readiness check

This patch set adds in readinessProbe for the following:

* nova-compute
* nova-scheduler
* nova-conductor
* nova-consoleauth
* nova-vnc-proxy
* nova-spiceproxy
* nova-ironic
* libvirt

Change-Id: I3ced89b83127856473710b552a0635ff28097213
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

subject: Add cinder readiness check

I pulled this out in a previous patch set, but after speaking with Pete, he suggested that it may be better to keep them separate (or per service).  While they the same right now, in the future, if we update the ready check to do something service specific (say the check has some cinder specific semantic), it would be easier to modify this file than to cope with a template.'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-06-27 02:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Patch Set 13 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-06-27 11:42:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-06-30 00:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Patch Set 15 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-06-30 02:45:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

For the readiness check in any service in OpenStack, I would REALLY like to have Spec document first so that we all can properly discuss and understand what these readiness check do.'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-08-06 01:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Workflow-1

@Jaesuk Ahn: Please review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582620/.

commit_message:
[DNM] TLS support for Horizon

This patch set introduces TLS handling in Apache for the OpenStack
Horizon dasbhoard service.

TODO:
* Introduce necessary plumbing to handle the certificate,
* Add and enable necessary manifests;
* Add gate tests.

Change-Id: I92aef735c40b903c4eeea03a720ed003a7c8a07f
External-tracking: #422126
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-21 14:13:33.000000000', 'message': 'Remove overlapping Listen directives on apache >= 2.4

As mentioned on the apache docs[0] having 2 overlapping
listen directories will cause the apache server to fail
with a fatal error. The seems like it was ignored on
earlier versions so we can use the version module to
change it based on the current apache version as to
not affect existing deployments

[0] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/es/bind.html

Change-Id: I8ce260e020375e93befa5e2e6df22eca0eaf9d07
'}]
commit_message:
Remove overlapping Listen directives on apache >= 2.4

As mentioned on the apache docs[0] having 2 overlapping
listen directories will cause the apache server to fail
with a fatal error. The seems like it was ignored on
earlier versions so we can use the version module to
change it based on the current apache version as to
not affect existing deployments

[0] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/es/bind.html

Change-Id: I8ce260e020375e93befa5e2e6df22eca0eaf9d07

commit_message:
Use setup_clients classmethod for clients initialization

resource_setup is used to create any resources or objects while
setup_clients is used to initialize clients.

Change-Id: I89110714651fe608721270025dfc0f3c56b078d6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 21:20:39.000000000', 'message': "Detect missing metric_id before passing through bytearray()

It is possible for a row in Cassandra to have a missing metric_id
(shows as 'null' in cqlsh).  This causes an ugly NoneType error
to be passed up to the user on the command line for
'monaca metric-list'.

Fix is to detect the missing value, log an error, and return the
row with None for the metric_id.

Change-Id: Ie617932c6b12a6cfe441510e120bb77a3470b9cf
Story: 2005305
Task: 30194
"}]
commit_message:
Detect missing metric_id before passing through bytearray()

It is possible for a row in Cassandra to have a missing metric_id
(shows as 'null' in cqlsh).  This causes an ugly NoneType error
to be passed up to the user on the command line for
'monaca metric-list'.

Fix is to detect the missing value, log an error, and return the
row with None for the metric_id.

Change-Id: Ie617932c6b12a6cfe441510e120bb77a3470b9cf
Story: 2005305
Task: 30194

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 17:08:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix group availability zone-backend host mismatch

Group availability zone is not set correctly in scheduler filter
properties which results in group availability zone-backend host
mismatch. This can lead to volume create failure for volumes in
the group. Fixing it by setting the availability zone in the
request spec in scheduler RPC call.

Change-Id: Icfa437d2d81ed29d0aceee776d86e28862c85274
Closes-bug: 1773446
(cherry picked from commit e08da42d81a6f4a5cbb72216ecddc0c4cf3807f4)
(cherry picked from commit 6ca3f2badfc76343db74ce6cea4b91b1c0fc6d17)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix group availability zone-backend host mismatch

Group availability zone is not set correctly in scheduler filter
properties which results in group availability zone-backend host
mismatch. This can lead to volume create failure for volumes in
the group. Fixing it by setting the availability zone in the
request spec in scheduler RPC call.

Change-Id: Icfa437d2d81ed29d0aceee776d86e28862c85274
Closes-bug: 1773446
(cherry picked from commit e08da42d81a6f4a5cbb72216ecddc0c4cf3807f4)
(cherry picked from commit 6ca3f2badfc76343db74ce6cea4b91b1c0fc6d17)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 17:18:45.000000000', 'message': "Delete related encryption provider when a volume type is deleting

Currently volume_type_destroy() in api.py does not delete related
encryption provider (if it exists). As a result, 'encryption' table
accumulates orphaned records.
This patch fixes to delete related encryption provider when
a volume type is deleting.

Change-Id: I90962108ced5043d74b7a7984196b14b2a13eeab
Closes-Bug: 1797640
(cherry picked from commit f3bc40ec34466e8f032160ddc30e9d2f875965c9)
(cherry picked from commit f6cdfe9a9da08325c53f7ec7eb30d8aec17834b0)
"}]
commit_message:
Delete related encryption provider when a volume type is deleting

Currently volume_type_destroy() in api.py does not delete related
encryption provider (if it exists). As a result, 'encryption' table
accumulates orphaned records.
This patch fixes to delete related encryption provider when
a volume type is deleting.

Change-Id: I90962108ced5043d74b7a7984196b14b2a13eeab
Closes-Bug: 1797640
(cherry picked from commit f3bc40ec34466e8f032160ddc30e9d2f875965c9)
(cherry picked from commit f6cdfe9a9da08325c53f7ec7eb30d8aec17834b0)

commit_message:
add resource filters to the included data_files

The resource_filters.json file has been added to the included data files
which will allow packagers to rely on the default file instead of having
to carry it as a template.

Change-Id: I2a0120c4ab199ef7ede09a707de8540ce98809af
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit 64d7a04c1eed4dac6ab8dab40e5a02a4d3389a1d)
(cherry picked from commit 613a7f3a420e21e3e45f3e23bfcba30bf1419f39)

[{'created': '2019-03-24 21:03:51.000000000', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ie35c84f73a1b1754958b279d149a9a212c7c7e46
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ie35c84f73a1b1754958b279d149a9a212c7c7e46

[{'created': '2019-03-26 04:36:58.000000000', 'message': "Avoid using 'truncate' on Windows

The Windows SMB driver has been broken by a recent change [1],
which is attempting to handle info file permissions, using the
'truncate' command along the way, which is not available on Windows.

We're not handling file permissions on Windows, so we can just skip
this step, avoiding this issue.

Change-Id: I1f92cef19cd2eed7ba845210f7ff89d88ba78f49
Closes-Bug: #1811369
(cherry picked from commit 133617828c37db78bcc71c5106c90818e0bebc3c)
(cherry picked from commit 8230238365f5a8b356d1b0af614a62d37aab21d3)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_remotefs.py
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid using 'truncate' on Windows

The Windows SMB driver has been broken by a recent change [1],
which is attempting to handle info file permissions, using the
'truncate' command along the way, which is not available on Windows.

We're not handling file permissions on Windows, so we can just skip
this step, avoiding this issue.

Change-Id: I1f92cef19cd2eed7ba845210f7ff89d88ba78f49
Closes-Bug: #1811369
(cherry picked from commit 133617828c37db78bcc71c5106c90818e0bebc3c)
(cherry picked from commit 8230238365f5a8b356d1b0af614a62d37aab21d3)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_remotefs.py

commit_message:
Fix for HPE MSA 2050 login failures

When authenticating to the array, use the 'response-type-numeric'
value to determine success, rather than doing a string match against the
'response-type' string, which is not guaranteed to be consistent.

Change-Id: I47fe1ff2dd5e24fffd5118aeab9473774eb58a61
Closes-Bug: #1808968
(cherry picked from commit 0565732a161ccc8bbef729019f7a24f2d862e606)
(cherry picked from commit 883b29cf46e3248ce9cc4061d8312343c20c8192)
(cherry picked from commit f712fabbec0a2d767a20adb23d05a75736732367)

[{'created': '2019-03-20 17:14:33.000000000', 'message': 'Retry on DBDeadLock affecting worker updates

Some updates on the workers table are prone to race conditions,
leading to DB deadlocks.

For example, when creating a large amount of volumes simultaneously,
some of them may hang in "Creating" state due to this issue.

We'll perform some retries when db deadlocks occur.

Change-Id: Iae211acd619070405f84a84ea58e88723a5e9f9b
Closes-Bug: #1789106
(cherry picked from commit e1fc723db123651ad66a339d559aed578126c74a)
(cherry picked from commit 781e964d6c5be7cafa7bc0a295bdc0c37764d939)
'}]
commit_message:
Retry on DBDeadLock affecting worker updates

Some updates on the workers table are prone to race conditions,
leading to DB deadlocks.

For example, when creating a large amount of volumes simultaneously,
some of them may hang in "Creating" state due to this issue.

We'll perform some retries when db deadlocks occur.

Change-Id: Iae211acd619070405f84a84ea58e88723a5e9f9b
Closes-Bug: #1789106
(cherry picked from commit e1fc723db123651ad66a339d559aed578126c74a)
(cherry picked from commit 781e964d6c5be7cafa7bc0a295bdc0c37764d939)

[{'created': '2019-03-22 00:06:14.000000000', 'message': 'More accurate agent restart state transfer

Ovs-agent can be very time-consuming in handling a large number
of ports. At this point, the ovs-agent status report may have
exceeded the set timeout value. Some flows updating operations
will not be triggerred. This results in flows loss during agent
restart, especially for hosts to hosts of vxlan tunnel flow.

This fix will let the ovs-agent explicitly, in the first rpc loop,
indicate that the status is restarted. Then l2pop will be required
to update fdb entries.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py

Conflicts:

commit_message:
More accurate agent restart state transfer

Ovs-agent can be very time-consuming in handling a large number
of ports. At this point, the ovs-agent status report may have
exceeded the set timeout value. Some flows updating operations
will not be triggerred. This results in flows loss during agent
restart, especially for hosts to hosts of vxlan tunnel flow.

This fix will let the ovs-agent explicitly, in the first rpc loop,
indicate that the status is restarted. Then l2pop will be required
to update fdb entries.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1813703
Closes-Bug: #1813714
Closes-Bug: #1813715
Closes-Bug: #1794991
Closes-Bug: #1799178

Change-Id: I8edc2deb509216add1fb21e1893f1c17dda80961
(cherry picked from commit a5244d6d44d2b66de27dc77efa7830fa657260be)
(cherry picked from commit cc49ab550179bdc76d79f48be67886681cb43d4e)
(cherry picked from commit 5ffca4966877454c605442e9e429aa83ea7d7348)

commit_message:
api-ref: fix description of os-server-external-events 'events' param

The description on the 'events' parameter for the
POST /os-server-external-events API did not make sense,
so this re-words it.

Change-Id: Iaec80e03a8ab0cd1b34126701bd0754953394e42

[{'created': '2019-04-03 22:06:40.000000000', 'message': "api-ref: document ordering for instance actions and events

Whenever I use the os-instance-actions API I have to look at
the DB API source code to figure out the sort order of the
resulting instanceActions and each action's events, which
is desc(created_at) in both cases (and desc(id) but that should
not matter here since the id is not exposed in the API).

This change mentions the resulting sort order of those fields
in the API reference so I can stop looking at source code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e7ae6c65c/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L5149
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e7ae6c65c/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L5289

Change-Id: Ib5758bc21296e8b6c041198661c147b8e99d57e5
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref: document ordering for instance actions and events

Whenever I use the os-instance-actions API I have to look at
the DB API source code to figure out the sort order of the
resulting instanceActions and each action's events, which
is desc(created_at) in both cases (and desc(id) but that should
not matter here since the id is not exposed in the API).

This change mentions the resulting sort order of those fields
in the API reference so I can stop looking at source code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e7ae6c65c/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L5149
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e7ae6c65c/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L5289

Change-Id: Ib5758bc21296e8b6c041198661c147b8e99d57e5

commit_message:
Fix spare amphora check and creation

This patch fixes an issue when the SparesPool table is empty that blocks
spare amphorae creation. It creates a new spares pool entry if the table
is empty.

Story 2005352
Task 30306

Change-Id: I0ce2778277640ee9e509c709bf8621b8b025d6d3

[{'created': '2019-03-29 09:10:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix QoS rule update

QoS rule (QosBandwidthLimitRule and QosMinimumBandwidthRule) update now
expects to have direction field in the API request for checking for
duplicates.
This patch changes this by using the rule fetched from the policy and
the update will work on that rule object instead of a newly created
object which for minimum_bandwidth rule has no default direction, which
causes the update to fail.

Change-Id: Ib8f95bf14193a50f22102668bed9208a93d1caba
Closes-Bug: #1815618
(cherry picked from commit c1999a2b2268a4f5477247974363e31cb54e0e6b)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix QoS rule update

QoS rule (QosBandwidthLimitRule and QosMinimumBandwidthRule) update now
expects to have direction field in the API request for checking for
duplicates.
This patch changes this by using the rule fetched from the policy and
the update will work on that rule object instead of a newly created
object which for minimum_bandwidth rule has no default direction, which
causes the update to fail.

Change-Id: Ib8f95bf14193a50f22102668bed9208a93d1caba
Closes-Bug: #1815618
(cherry picked from commit c1999a2b2268a4f5477247974363e31cb54e0e6b)

commit_message:
Increase EC_MAX_FRAGMENTS to 64

... with tests for 60+4 on liberasurecode_rs_vand, isa_l_rs_vand,
isa_l_rs_cauchy, jerasure_rs_vand, and jerasure_rs_cauchy. Use 60+4 to
avoid the known-issues with isa_l_rs_vand and >= 5 parity frags.

Increase the unit test job timeout since these new tests take a bit :-/

Change-Id: Idf989c7367dc76e9a3c44b785f071b4c92250a8e

commit_message:
Fix the amphora base port coming up

A recent change[1] broke the base port IP address coming up in the
amphora. This would cause active/standby and single topology amphora
with members on the VIP subnet to fail.

This patch resolves this issue by not flushing the eth1:0 address.

Story: 2005383
Task: 30368

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/648504/

Change-Id: I52e7e9f172b7783bae09be76cc137f4e7198165f
(cherry picked from commit 41ff43131f030d7a01f6d09a1c12f16cf0d400dd)

commit_message:
WIP: Change CONF.my_ip to be IPOpt

The my_ip config option is intended to be an IP address
and is used as a default for several other options, like
metadata_host, which are expected to be IP addresses.

This changes my_ip to be an IPOpt along with the other options
that rely on it as a default option.

Change-Id: Iccaed761beb94b878a6bed0e1aa0821564bccf0a
Related-Bug: #1713144

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE testing overlay mtus with zuul jobs

This depends on a change that updates how we deal with MTUs in the infra
side overlay networking. Double checking that everything works before we
merge that zuul-jobs parent change.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578153/
Change-Id: Idce0a171ac1ceda2f12d80da89f39c1eb78e0dfd

[{'created': '2018-05-29 15:15:07.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Cap cmd2 to < 0.9.0"

This reverts commit 63e5e1dd9638173a8f959be07842e445bafcc837.

Upstream cmd2 appears to have sorted out how to host their packages on
pypi such that their 0.8 series can be python2 and 0.9 series python3
and have pip do the right thing for us. This revert will confirm this
for us.

Change-Id: I3f4d36f835983daade932798771e408b1860b6b9
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Cap cmd2 to < 0.9.0"

This reverts commit 63e5e1dd9638173a8f959be07842e445bafcc837.

Upstream cmd2 appears to have sorted out how to host their packages on
pypi such that their 0.8 series can be python2 and 0.9 series python3
and have pip do the right thing for us. This revert will confirm this
for us.

Change-Id: I3f4d36f835983daade932798771e408b1860b6b9

feature: quadiron backend and tests

QuadIron is an open source library that supports a large number of
parities in a systematic or non-systematic setting. This changeset also
include the proper unit tests to validate the new backend.

The code already has some logic to support more than 32 fragments (bitvalues)
but it is currently not fully functional. This changeset brings full support

bitmaps to bitvalues in some specific functions.

Change-Id: I9960f74104a3d5777812b54df8036d718be2d001
'}]
commit_message:
fix: proper support of more than 32 fragments

The code already has some logic to support more than 32 fragments (bitvalues)
but it is currently not fully functional. This changeset brings full support
to backends supporting more than 32 fragments, especially by changing from
bitmaps to bitvalues in some specific functions.

Change-Id: I9960f74104a3d5777812b54df8036d718be2d001

[{'created': '2017-10-20 23:47:40.000000000', 'message': "Install PyYAML from pypi

We need yaml support in python for parsing the features.yaml file. We
had been installing this from the system package repos but new pip won't
be able to uninstall the older system package version to install the
latest version from pypi later when devstack runs.

Avoid this by installing the package with pip from pypi so that there is
no need to upgrade it later.

Change-Id: I56a0a86fef618563d1cb7ff66c2fef9dbb8bef49
"}]
commit_message:
Install PyYAML from pypi

We need yaml support in python for parsing the features.yaml file. We
had been installing this from the system package repos but new pip won't
be able to uninstall the older system package version to install the
latest version from pypi later when devstack runs.

Avoid this by installing the package with pip from pypi so that there is
no need to upgrade it later.

Change-Id: I56a0a86fef618563d1cb7ff66c2fef9dbb8bef49

Test pip 10 works with devstack before release.

Pip 10 introduces some major changes so lets test tip of master from pip
now to find out if it breaks us completely.

Change-Id: I5ebd8ee1cbb54bca9505b30c226a664e1bb7ba38
'}, {'created': '2017-09-05 17:00:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add more debugging around udevadm settle

We have seen at least one occurance of mkswap failing after a successful
udevadm settle on the future swap device. Add the --debug flag to
udevadm for more output and use time(1) to record the lengh of time

commit_message:
Add more debugging around udevadm settle

We have seen at least one occurance of mkswap failing after a successful
udevadm settle on the future swap device. Add the --debug flag to
udevadm for more output and use time(1) to record the lengh of time
udevadm waited. Note we use time because it prints to stderr which
ansible will interleave with the rest of the logs nicely.

Change-Id: I5ebd8ee1cbb54bca9505b30c226a664e1bb7ba38

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 15:08:00.000000000', 'message': '[OVS] Exception message when retrieving bridge-id and is not present

In the OVS agent, when setting up the ancillary bridges, the parameter
external_id:bridge-id is retrieved. If this parameter is not defined
(e.g.: manually created bridges), ovsdbapp writes an error in the logs.
This information is irrelevant and can cause confusion during debugging time.

Change-Id: Ic85db65f651eb67fcb56b937ebe5850ec1e8f29f
Closes-Bug: #1815912
(cherry picked from commit 769e9712936187b48984d7ab73bd7e6611ef4b60)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS] Exception message when retrieving bridge-id and is not present

In the OVS agent, when setting up the ancillary bridges, the parameter
external_id:bridge-id is retrieved. If this parameter is not defined
(e.g.: manually created bridges), ovsdbapp writes an error in the logs.
This information is irrelevant and can cause confusion during debugging time.

Change-Id: Ic85db65f651eb67fcb56b937ebe5850ec1e8f29f
Closes-Bug: #1815912
(cherry picked from commit 769e9712936187b48984d7ab73bd7e6611ef4b60)

the main centos repos. Avoid problems where people get packages they

bridges to provide the vxlan connectivity.

Change-Id: I1854244eee857141b2aaf280cf3f4e33e687f421

commit_message:
Hack in linux bridge vxlan support

OVS continues to be problematic on centos because it does not live in
the main centos repos. Avoid problems where people get packages they
don't expect from the rdo repo (which provides ovs) by using linux
bridges to provide the vxlan connectivity.

Change-Id: I1854244eee857141b2aaf280cf3f4e33e687f421

commit_message:
Use IP version appropriate dns servers

If we have routable ipv6 then don't configure ipv4 dns servers as these
packets may have to traverse NAT and are generally unreliable. We want
to force ipv6 for all lookups in this case.

At the same time don't configure ipv6 servers if ipv6 is not routable as
this leads to lookups that fail and fallback on ipv4. Just configure
ipv4 servers in this case to avoid these extra lookups that will fail.

Change-Id: I9717c14bec92d4aeb460461fb3d9f5065c5af0f7

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-19 22:37:25.000000000', 'message': 'Tune unbound for our test systems

This tunes unbound to use more cpus, slightly more memory in total for
caching (if necessary), and allows for using so-reuseport which
increases udp performance.

The values chosen here take into account the total number of cpus
available on our test systems (4 or 8), the relatively memory
constrainted environment we run in (hence not increasing memory
significantly), and the fact that all our linux kernels are >=3.10 which
means SO_REUSEPORT is valid.

Change-Id: Ib56362a43f0b456d34acaa6c378a38be39c6336b
'}]
commit_message:
Tune unbound for our test systems

This tunes unbound to use more cpus, slightly more memory in total for
caching (if necessary), and allows for using so-reuseport which
increases udp performance.

The values chosen here take into account the total number of cpus
available on our test systems (4 or 8), the relatively memory
constrainted environment we run in (hence not increasing memory
significantly), and the fact that all our linux kernels are >=3.10 which
means SO_REUSEPORT is valid.

Change-Id: Ib56362a43f0b456d34acaa6c378a38be39c6336b

commit_message:
DNM run tests without tls-proxy

This is to compare job runtimes and runtimes of inidividual tools like
OSC against the jobs that have tls proxy enabled.

Depends-On: Ic5f1844ce732d447ee980b3c9fdc417f72482609
Change-Id: I825477e8d85b2a521aad5c808c262ae75061c249

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-14546 : SUCCESS in 1h 19m 51s'}, {'account_id': 27336, 'date': '2018-02-22 15:01:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-22 18:14:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

The commit message is a bit confusing, but I think I understand this now.

The snapshot image_meta comes from the instance.system_metadata, and the min_disk is the max between the image min_disk and the flavor.root_gb, added a long time ago:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/43782/3/nova/utils.py

As a fix for bug 1039662 which didn't take into account volume-backed instances.

For an ephemeral instance, if I create it with a 20GB flavor and snapshot it, the image says you need a minimum of 20GB to boot the image. If I'm using a volume as my root disk though, then the flavor.root_gb is irrelevant since it's not used, therefore we shouldn't preserve the flavor.root_gb min_disk into the volume-backed snapshot metadata since it won't be used anyway.

So I think this is a proper solution, albeit confusing to sort out."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-22 18:15:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Actually still wondering if the min_disk should equal the root volume size...'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2018-02-22 18:15:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This doesn't look right to me. I think it's attempting to rectify the problem long after it has happened. min_disk is a property of the image, and associate with the intended workload of the image. It's set by a person, and it's not the same as size. I think we should leave it alone. Whatever is setting min_disk to flavor size in the first place is wrong, and we should fix that."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-22 20:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

-1 for the original thing I said in my comments, not for what mdbooth is saying.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-06 00:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Related: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/407397/'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-06 00:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Moving focus to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/407397/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 07:04:35.000000000', 'message': "Snapshot the volume-backed instance without min_disk in image metadate.

You can use the following steps to reproduce：
1.Specifically,create first instance using a image with create
 new volume(new volume size is smaller than the favor's root disk size).
2.create a snapshot of the first instance.
3.failed to create a second instance using the first instance snapshot.
Error info is as follows：
Volume is smaller than minimum size specified in image metadata.
Volume size is XXX bytes,minimum size is XXX bytes.(HTTP 400)

No matter what type of flavor will have this error,
so snapshot the volume-backed instance without min_disk in image metadate.

Change-Id: Id8f764703c2ad54681aa2efcc68ae741a559fcdd
Closes-bug: #1748348
"}, {'created': '2018-02-11 01:44:08.000000000', 'message': "Snapshot the volume-backed instance without min_disk in image metadata

The problem was failed in created a second instance using
the volume-backed instance snapshot with min_disk in metadata,
if the volume-backed instance was created using a image with
create new volume and new volume size is smaller than the
flavor's root disk size.

This fixes the problem by snapshotting the volume-backed instance
without min_disk in image metadata.

Change-Id: Id8f764703c2ad54681aa2efcc68ae741a559fcdd
Closes-bug: #1748348
"}]
commit_message:
Snapshot the volume-backed instance without min_disk in image metadata

The problem was failed in created a second instance using
the volume-backed instance snapshot with min_disk in metadata,
if the volume-backed instance was created using a image with
create new volume and new volume size is smaller than the
flavor's root disk size.

This fixes the problem by snapshotting the volume-backed instance
without min_disk in image metadata.

Change-Id: Id8f764703c2ad54681aa2efcc68ae741a559fcdd
Closes-bug: #1748348

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-05 17:01:59.000000000', 'message': "Only assert connection header if set in request

Update the TestFile functional tests' header asserts to only assert the
presence and value of the connection header if it is set in the initial
request. Different web servers may respond differently depending on what
server is used and how it is configured so we can't reliably assert
anything about connection unless we initially set a value in the
request.

This addresses an issue with functional testing against the devstack
configured keystone+swift install behind apache2. This set up defaults
to Connection: close as python requests doesn't gracefully handle keep
alive'd connections.

Change-Id: I16c9788549c8948b4216d61372ffdaf0c1be76ba

commit_message:
Func test hacks to work under against apache2

This is an assortment of hackarounds to get the swift functional testing
working against apache2 with tls enabled. This isn't intended to be an
end state, but a first step in getting a common understanding of the
issues that need to be fixed.

I expect that this change will end up getting split into 2 or 3 changes
over time that properly solve the problems it hacks around.

Change-Id: I16c9788549c8948b4216d61372ffdaf0c1be76ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 15:07:45.000000000', 'message': '[OVS] Exception message when retrieving bridge-id and is not present

In the OVS agent, when setting up the ancillary bridges, the parameter
external_id:bridge-id is retrieved. If this parameter is not defined
(e.g.: manually created bridges), ovsdbapp writes an error in the logs.
This information is irrelevant and can cause confusion during debugging time.

Change-Id: Ic85db65f651eb67fcb56b937ebe5850ec1e8f29f
Closes-Bug: #1815912
(cherry picked from commit 769e9712936187b48984d7ab73bd7e6611ef4b60)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS] Exception message when retrieving bridge-id and is not present

In the OVS agent, when setting up the ancillary bridges, the parameter
external_id:bridge-id is retrieved. If this parameter is not defined
(e.g.: manually created bridges), ovsdbapp writes an error in the logs.
This information is irrelevant and can cause confusion during debugging time.

Change-Id: Ic85db65f651eb67fcb56b937ebe5850ec1e8f29f
Closes-Bug: #1815912
(cherry picked from commit 769e9712936187b48984d7ab73bd7e6611ef4b60)

commit_message:
Switch to httpd instead of gnocchi-api

The Gnocchi role uses mod_wsgi with HTTPD to host the service,
therefore this change reflects that.

Change-Id: I5c2b91e940ba45a00823278ad4fcd75b2442d369

commit_message:
Run smoke and dashboard tests by default

The smoke tests are very useful in running a very small subnet that
can make sure that the services are fundamentally working and run
quickly.

The dashboard tests also help confirm some of that and make sure
that the dashboard is usable.  This should improve the reliability
of our Tempest runs and make them faster.

The dashboard tests are only active when horizon is deployed.

Change-Id: Ie416199497fea6cb5ead02b168ec1824bc9f727f
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

commit_message:
Use UNIX socket instead of TCP socket

In certain use cases, you may be listening on a different interface
and it is not possible to listen to multiple interfaces with MySQL.

This changes the behaviour to connect via the local socket, as
Galera treats 'localhost' as a connection via the UNIX socket and
'127.0.0.1' as using the TCP socket.

This will allow using Galera on a specific interface while still
letting the bootstrap process talk to the local machine via the
socket which is still available.

Change-Id: I9772aa58fc858f85dc8cbe7cc740aeab12790739

commit_message:
Run all tests without containers

There is not much of a reason for us to run these tests in
containers, we can speed things up a lot more if we ran them
outside containers.  Also, only run the containers preparation
if we have any defined containers.

Also, start collection of the hosts file which is very useful
in troubleshooting things like RabbitMQ.

Change-Id: I6259dc91b4830c3bff9e9661837673f95c45ba86

commit_message:
distro: refactor container_registry_deploy_docker_distribution

In order to allow for different deployment methods, this patch
removes usage of the container_registry_deploy_docker_distribution
variable and replaces it by `container_registry_deployment_method`
which can allow for multiple deployment methods.

Change-Id: I573bcbdfcd7df9efa908f8d8d9bc9230afafd49a

commit_message:
systemd: cleanups

The systemd module allows you to run a daemon-reload directly
from the task, so we can do that instead of having to run an
extra task.

Every modern operating system uses systemd nowadays anyways so
there's no point in having a conditional on it.

Change-Id: I9976f1a2083fa07aa03d16b8150d11e44a21db41

subject: tests: clean-up
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-07 21:32:42.000000000', 'message': "tests: drop pep8 tests

We don't acutally have any Python code in all of this project so
there's no need to run pep8, flake8 and family.

Change-Id: Ib25003dc88aacd7b8e75c46fe0336fb27c9d739f
"}, {'created': '2018-12-07 21:59:27.000000000', 'message': "tests: clean-up

We don't acutally have any Python code in all of this project so
there's no need to run pep8, flake8 and family.

The ansible-lint can be called directly and we can just skip the
tasks that don't pass linting in the task directly (or fix them!)

There are some tox environments which are also not being used at
all such as bindep and releasenotes.  In addition, the basepython
is common and we can avoid repeating it.

Change-Id: Ib25003dc88aacd7b8e75c46fe0336fb27c9d739f
"}, {'created': '2018-12-08 01:05:37.000000000', 'message': "tests: clean-up

We don't acutally have any Python code in all of this project so
there's no need to run pep8, flake8 and family.

The ansible-lint can be called directly and we can just skip the
tasks that don't pass linting in the task directly (or fix them!)

There are some tox environments which are also not being used at
all such as bindep and releasenotes.  In addition, the basepython
is common and we can avoid repeating it.  We also add an empty
bindep file so that we don't install things we don't need inside
the gate.

Change-Id: Ib25003dc88aacd7b8e75c46fe0336fb27c9d739f
"}]
commit_message:
tests: clean-up

We don't acutally have any Python code in all of this project so
there's no need to run pep8, flake8 and family.

The ansible-lint can be called directly and we can just skip the
tasks that don't pass linting in the task directly (or fix them!)

There are some tox environments which are also not being used at
all such as bindep and releasenotes.  In addition, the basepython
is common and we can avoid repeating it.  We also add an empty
bindep file so that we don't install things we don't need inside
the gate.

Change-Id: Ib25003dc88aacd7b8e75c46fe0336fb27c9d739f

commit_message:
Make version_string() lazy load version info

This changes version_string() to return a string like object instead of
a string that won't import pkg_resources until we try to render the
version somewhere.

Change-Id: I1acf45850e82e5bd7bbf70d5c80666874ef10f91

Build failed (check-tripleo pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing


- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-nonha http://logs.openstack.org/01/357401/1/check-tripleo/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-nonha/f6e105a/ : FAILURE in 1h 02m 56s'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2016-08-22 03:23:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

ha, it took me a while to see what was going on here.  the output from du (just on my temp dir) is something like 

 1336    ./dib.fedora-24.log.1
 4       ./krb5cc_1000

you get

 00000000  31 33 33 36 09 2e 2f 64  69 62 2e 66 65 64 6f 72  |1336../dib.fedor|
 00000010  61 2d 32 34 2e 6c 6f 67  2e 31 00 34 09 2e 2f 6b  |a-24.log.1.4../k|

i.e. "\0 4 \t . / k" just like you'd expect.  but then bash turns this into

 00000000  31 33 33 36 09 2e 2f 64  69 62 2e 66 65 64 6f 72  |1336../dib.fedor|
 00000010  61 2d 32 34 2e 6c 6f 67  2e 31 34 09 2e 2f 6b 72  |a-24.log.14../kr|

when you assign it with $() -- i.e. note the \0 just went missing

It turns out bash has the following code in the process subst function

 /* Read the output of the command through the pipe.  This may need to be
     changed to understand multibyte characters in the future. */
  while (1)
    {
 ...
      if (c == 0)
        {
 #if 0
          internal_warning ("read_comsub: ignored null byte in input");
 #endif
          continue;
        }

 ...

This actually makes sense that you can't have NUL values in bash variables, but it wasn't something I'd ever actually thought about.  TIL I guess

So the whole storing-in-a-variable thing was just a convenience, of possibly dubious value seeing as how large this gets.  So, it might be possible to rebase this on I6a6d22c2142e0f199490c39cca8c94769e4b0232 and make sure NUL values only go through pipes if we feel strongly.

As it turned out, the problem here isn't actually to do with this pipeline failing.  Something in the Xenial build is turning stdout to O_NONBLOCK, which means large writes can fail with EAGAIN.  Filter tools like cat have no concept of EAGAIN and just die.  We need to find what's doing this and make it stop ... or or i have some ideas for dib-run-parts to maybe check the value and warn us.'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-09-12 21:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Agreed - lets fix this with the other proposed patch which doesnt use env vars'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-09-12 21:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:52:25.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-04-06 00:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-08-18 18:11:51.000000000', 'message': "Make disk usage reporting more robust

To avoid problems with sort and numfmt and their default newline
delimiter switch to zero byte delimted lines. This ensures that
filenames with funny contents don't cause problems for us. We also tell
numfmt to warn on invalid content rather than erroring.

We have seen builds in infra land that trap the exit handler when
running the usage reporting. Specifically when running through the
sort | numfmt | egrep | grep pipeline.

Change-Id: I600b8d8a1d609d3ccb055ef1b8708917e75a1eb7
"}]
commit_message:
Make disk usage reporting more robust

To avoid problems with sort and numfmt and their default newline
delimiter switch to zero byte delimted lines. This ensures that
filenames with funny contents don't cause problems for us. We also tell
numfmt to warn on invalid content rather than erroring.

We have seen builds in infra land that trap the exit handler when
running the usage reporting. Specifically when running through the
sort | numfmt | egrep | grep pipeline.

Change-Id: I600b8d8a1d609d3ccb055ef1b8708917e75a1eb7

Use public IPs for all comms

Check if we can just use public IPs everywhere.

They keystone failure is due to the change from using ports to distinguish user vs admin to using URLs instead. I've fixed this in my patch to switch from stud to mod_proxy, https://review.openstack.org/301172

I suppose a similar change could be made for the current stud proxy but I'd prefer to focus on switching to mod_proxy."}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2016-07-26 14:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2'}, {'account_id': 7662, 'date': '2016-07-26 14:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

My initial plan for testing SSL/TLS was a slow-go approach. I got the code more or less working and the tempest smoke suite working, then created an experimental job. My plan was to promote that to running all the time non-voting for some period, then to voting. In retrospect I think the "rip the bandaid off" method would have been better.

I've been focusing on the proxy mode but the native SSL stuff came along more or less for free so I went ahead and coded that as well. I'm not opposed to a gate job for that it's more a question of whether that should be a goal or not. I've tended to get strange looks when I've brought up native SSL support, at least until the services move away from eventlet and into Apache.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-07-26 18:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

commit_message:
Use overlay always to make SERVICE_HOST setup easy

This simplifies knowing what the SERVICE_HOST should be as we use the
overlay network always for setup.

Change-Id: Ia3c455938078cc57a07afa9d873f3ca51d7538ad

commit_message:
Have swift pass through non log data unoutched

We want to host images and javascript and other non html/text log data
in swift. Previously the swift generator would always logify all
requests breaking the hosting of non log data. Update the swift
generator and wsgi application to pass through data in swift untouched
if it is not known log data.

This refactors the wsgi application and its use of generators a bit.
Basically adds a process step where we can either choose to filter and
format logs or pass through untouched.

Change-Id: I83416d120ee7b99dc68e52001262d1eb90bf1da1

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Fixed cleanup long duration

wait_for_status() is looking for loadbalancer objects with an
ACTIVE status, even when they were already DELETED.
It caused current tests to finish after ~20 minutes.
This patch reduces the total duration to ~7 minutes.

Change-Id: I36dfe5ec7fd82a050d46b8f836f40965a4f6ee76

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-12 22:47:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add trap handler for aiopcpu ssh errors

We are seeing ssh errors in multinode setups that we haev been unable to
debug externally. Add a sit and wait trap handler around ssh so that we
can log into the machines after they fail to ssh in an effort to further
debug.

Change-Id: Ifba50320324a5ca9f5d4e7493291a961c4e0de9a
'}]
commit_message:
Add trap handler for aiopcpu ssh errors

We are seeing ssh errors in multinode setups that we haev been unable to
debug externally. Add a sit and wait trap handler around ssh so that we
can log into the machines after they fail to ssh in an effort to further
debug.

Change-Id: Ifba50320324a5ca9f5d4e7493291a961c4e0de9a

commit_message:
Try PyMySQL as Python MySQLDB alternative.

Doing this in d-g because ceilometer breaks this in devstack. Can test
it here by disabling ceilometer for this one thing.

Change-Id: I2cb2599ebd397931ea5aaf44655c8b68b48ac3fe

commit_message:
Add new Galera Cluster bootstraping method

For systems with systemd there is a wrapper program to bootstrap
Galera Cluster - galera_new_cluster.

This patch introduces a simple method to find a location of a given
executable.

Using this method we can check if a command 'galera_new_cluster' exists
- if it is present it is used to bootstrap Galera Cluster.

Co-Authored-By: Jacek Kaniuk <j.kaniuk@samsung.com>

Change-Id: Iab8f6dd7f908f1e031135e2136abeb228890108a
Signed-off-by: Kasper Hasior <k.hasior@samsung.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-08 01:02:23.000000000', 'message': "Test if ipv6 works with services the easy way

We don't need a whole new job to start this work. In fact it is much
much easier to just propose a change that enforces the new criteria you
wnt then iterate from there using depends-on as necessary. This keeps
the job list down and avoids adding experimental jobs that will die on
the vine.

Change-Id: If7ac5f61eba967c77ad9224ce2e6b83d5aa8ec77
"}, {'created': '2015-08-08 01:08:17.000000000', 'message': 'Test if ipv6 works with services the easy way

Hard configure devstack to use ipv6 only for services.
This should force clients to also use ipv6. Since we do want
to continue testing ipv4 this is more of a test change to see
what breaks and can be used to continue to test fixes as they
arrive (can use depends on tags in this change to collect and
test the fixes as they are written).

Change-Id: If7ac5f61eba967c77ad9224ce2e6b83d5aa8ec77
'}]
commit_message:
Test if ipv6 works with services the easy way

Hard configure devstack to use ipv6 only for services.
This should force clients to also use ipv6. Since we do want
to continue testing ipv4 this is more of a test change to see
what breaks and can be used to continue to test fixes as they
arrive (can use depends on tags in this change to collect and
test the fixes as they are written).

Change-Id: If7ac5f61eba967c77ad9224ce2e6b83d5aa8ec77

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-26 22:33:33.000000000', 'message': 'Use 3/4 of CPUs by default instead of 1/2

We now run the tempest scenario tests after the non scenario tests
serially. This means the biggest contenders for cpu are separated out
and run serially on their own. As a result of this we should be able to
run more of the non scenario tests concurrently without thrashing the
cpu too badly.

Test this by increasing the concurrency to nproc * 3/4 instead of nproc
* 1/2.

Change-Id: Iebfe2a598c46ab59a843b3783daf2a86be24a798
'}]
commit_message:
Use 3/4 of CPUs by default instead of 1/2

We now run the tempest scenario tests after the non scenario tests
serially. This means the biggest contenders for cpu are separated out
and run serially on their own. As a result of this we should be able to
run more of the non scenario tests concurrently without thrashing the
cpu too badly.

Test this by increasing the concurrency to nproc * 3/4 instead of nproc
* 1/2.

Change-Id: Iebfe2a598c46ab59a843b3783daf2a86be24a798

When the conductor has debugging enabled, that command is

Change-Id: Ife77707210f8289d8f2e0223fb9ee1909d798546

commit_message:
ipmi: Ignore sensor debug data

When the conductor has debugging enabled, that command is
passed to ipmitool to enable debugging of other commands.

However, this means tons of extra data is dumped as part of
the sensor data collection for ironic, which breaks string
parsing and ultimately metrics collection.

Since we can identify these lines, lets ignore them.

Change-Id: Ife77707210f8289d8f2e0223fb9ee1909d798546
Story: 2005332
Task: 30267
(cherry picked from commit 418a5668a4c947326f28cf13e962e914ebadc012)

commit_message:
Additional logs for Mariadb restore strategy

This patch adds additional debug log messages when executing
mysqld_safe script phase responsible for root password reset.

Change-Id: I1f2b6dbf28dfddb7d0c57c26873c2cba8e8ff130
Co-Authored-By: Kasper Hasior <k.hasior@samsung.com>

commit_message:
simplify README.rst

Move some of the user intro documentation around so that the
README.rst file can be use to publish packages to PyPI. The :ref: role
for linking between pages in Sphinx is not available for use in readme
files, so most of the content is moved into the main documentation.

Change-Id: Ic7d623b3ea9f6e5485cc5bafb1475611b5fe78a7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
(cherry picked from commit b839ab565e79c3d231157bb30573780234777387)

commit_message:
simplify README.rst

Move some of the user intro documentation around so that the
README.rst file can be use to publish packages to PyPI. The :ref: role
for linking between pages in Sphinx is not available for use in readme
files, so most of the content is moved into the main documentation.

commit_message:
change the dist name to 'openstack-congress'

We are updating all Python projects to publish artifacts to PyPI. The name
"congress" is already taken there by another project, and they have not
responded to our request to claim the name. We therefore need to change
the dist name used to package congress. We have some other projects
publishing using an "openstack-" prefix, so I propose using the name
"openstack-congress". This will not change the imports or anything else
about how the code works, just how it is packaged.

Change-Id: I076a4025c40e71845e62fe1747cb7c33a477ea16
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
ovs: survive errors from check_ovs_status

Instead of allowing an error to bubble up and exit from rpc_loop, catch
it and assume the switch is dead which will make the agent to wait until
the switch is back without failing the service.

Change-Id: Ic3095dd42b386f56b1f75ebb6a125606f295551b
Closes-Bug: #1731494
(cherry picked from commit 544597c6ef9fb297693dbeb0f2d7dc22f3a1b25d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-27 09:44:07.000000000', 'message': 'Check if process' cmdline is "space separarated"

According to proc man page process arguments in /proc/{pid}/cmdline
should be separated with '\0' char and that char was used in
neutron.agent.linux.utils.get_cmdline_from_pid function.

Recently in fullstack tests it was noticed that sometimes it may
happend that those arguments are separated with space char and this
caused failed test because async_process.AsyncProcess() was not able
to check that process is really active.

This patch adds attempt to split cmdline arguments with space in case
when split with '\0' returns only 1 element.

Change-Id: I35d4c0e2cf56fc3ff15cf307aaf11a8ad8489e1f
Closes-Bug: #1820870
(cherry picked from commit cf13b2f0cc18fdb1d512ecfe9f2c65ad4bb284dd)
'}]
commit_message:
Check if process' cmdline is "space separarated"

According to proc man page process arguments in /proc/{pid}/cmdline
should be separated with '\0' char and that char was used in
neutron.agent.linux.utils.get_cmdline_from_pid function.

Recently in fullstack tests it was noticed that sometimes it may
happend that those arguments are separated with space char and this
caused failed test because async_process.AsyncProcess() was not able
to check that process is really active.

This patch adds attempt to split cmdline arguments with space in case
when split with '\0' returns only 1 element.

Change-Id: I35d4c0e2cf56fc3ff15cf307aaf11a8ad8489e1f
Closes-Bug: #1820870
(cherry picked from commit cf13b2f0cc18fdb1d512ecfe9f2c65ad4bb284dd)

commit_message:
Check if process' cmdline is "space separarated"

According to proc man page process arguments in /proc/{pid}/cmdline
should be separated with '\0' char and that char was used in
neutron.agent.linux.utils.get_cmdline_from_pid function.

Recently in fullstack tests it was noticed that sometimes it may
happend that those arguments are separated with space char and this
caused failed test because async_process.AsyncProcess() was not able
to check that process is really active.

This patch adds attempt to split cmdline arguments with space in case
when split with '\0' returns only 1 element.

Change-Id: I35d4c0e2cf56fc3ff15cf307aaf11a8ad8489e1f
Closes-Bug: #1820870
(cherry picked from commit cf13b2f0cc18fdb1d512ecfe9f2c65ad4bb284dd)

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-collect-logs project to TripleO

Collect-logs role exists in openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras,
But in order to make it reusable, we are moving this bundled
role to a seperate repo so that other deployment tools can
reuse it.

Change-Id: I560eff86b1ef30938b4455d043ad5c7f3a45519a
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/647665

commit_message:
simplify README.rst

Move some of the user intro documentation around so that the
README.rst file can be use to publish packages to PyPI. The :ref: role
for linking between pages in Sphinx is not available for use in readme
files, so most of the content is moved into the main documentation.

Change-Id: Ic7d623b3ea9f6e5485cc5bafb1475611b5fe78a7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Rename router processing queue code to be more generic

Moved the router processing queue code to the agent/common
directory and renamed it "resource processing queue".  This
way it can be consumed by other agents, or possibly even
moved to neutron-lib in the future.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py

Change-Id: I735cf5b0a915828c420c3316b78a48f6d54035e6
(cherry picked from commit f24f3b6b7bce0bd5e50bbb2d16f5e162198435de)

commit_message:
Enhance error handling for InvalidBDMVolume

In cases were cross_az is set to false the logging of InvalidBDMVolume
is misleading. This fix adds a reason the the error message.

Change-Id: I8ddaf9db6537224cc24a499726ba31031c870386
Closes-bug: #1739368

commit_message:
Set lower addr to avoid IP out of range

Since port creating can result an IP address in the
entire CIDR especially small subnet. And those next
N IP actions can be out of subnet IP range. This
patch gives the original test port a specific IP
addr to prevent this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1812404
Change-Id: I34cb99a518d4469c7d1ca9e2897671608b2b81ad
(cherry picked from commit 63ea9d7bcc57e64b136f56a7e5ba015a5b4ee3bb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 14:25:01.000000000', 'message': "[Functional tests] Change way how conntrack entries are checked

In netlink_lib functional tests module there are listed conntrack
entries and those entries are assert to some expected list.
It may happen that sometimes some additional entries from other
tests will also be in the list and that cause failures of
netlink_lib tests.

So this patch changes way how those assertions are done. For now
it will check if each of expected entries is in entries list and
in case of delete entries tests, it will also check if any of
deleted entries isn't actually in list.

Change-Id: I30c18f141a8356b060902e6493ba0657b21619ad
Closes-Bug: #1817295
(cherry picked from commit 798c6c731fc5872ade8b5eb1f571a2c002c8c0fb)
"}]
commit_message:
[Functional tests] Change way how conntrack entries are checked

In netlink_lib functional tests module there are listed conntrack
entries and those entries are assert to some expected list.
It may happen that sometimes some additional entries from other
tests will also be in the list and that cause failures of
netlink_lib tests.

So this patch changes way how those assertions are done. For now
it will check if each of expected entries is in entries list and
in case of delete entries tests, it will also check if any of
deleted entries isn't actually in list.

Change-Id: I30c18f141a8356b060902e6493ba0657b21619ad
Closes-Bug: #1817295
(cherry picked from commit 798c6c731fc5872ade8b5eb1f571a2c002c8c0fb)

commit_message:
[Functional tests] Change way how conntrack entries are checked

In netlink_lib functional tests module there are listed conntrack
entries and those entries are assert to some expected list.
It may happen that sometimes some additional entries from other
tests will also be in the list and that cause failures of
netlink_lib tests.

So this patch changes way how those assertions are done. For now
it will check if each of expected entries is in entries list and
in case of delete entries tests, it will also check if any of
deleted entries isn't actually in list.

Change-Id: I30c18f141a8356b060902e6493ba0657b21619ad
Closes-Bug: #1817295
(cherry picked from commit 798c6c731fc5872ade8b5eb1f571a2c002c8c0fb)

raising TypeErrors.

commit_message:
Add a script for counting blueprints

This is useful for recording data during the cycle to use to create
a burndown chart for blueprints. The script counts: Targeted,
Approved, and Implemented blueprints. It also checks if there are any
approved specs whose corresponding blueprints need approval and emits
warnings for each one found.

Since this shares some code with the existing move_implemented_specs
script, the common code is factored out into an importable lib.py
module.

This also adds a tox target for running the script and makes it share
the same envdir as the move-implemented-specs target since both need
the same dependency of launchpadlib.

Change-Id: I9a9d3f7f2883a6eb151230da651d9a4c4fda77b4

commit_message:
Stop project gating before retirement

We didn't to any release and don't use these projects for the years:
* xstatic-angular-ui-router
* xstatic-vis


The retirement is announced in the openstack-discuss mailing list [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004499.html

Change-Id: I7fa241d88a8b1e475489099871a3477d17c9f24f

commit_message:
Remove psycopg2>=2.7 from requirements

The package is needed only for an experimental feature, but
causes packaging issue on RHEL/CentOS 7. Remove from requirements and
require manual install to enable the experimental feature.

Change-Id: Ibe6b423f3eb1e3759931fed032543d5bca40e508
Closes-Bug: 1823095

commit_message:
blacklist octavia for stein

While projects are moving towards octavia-lib, some haven't finished
the transition in stein and thus need to require octavia. For example
the results in [1].

This patch adds octavia to the blacklist for stable/stein so that
projects can still require octavia. It's expected this won't be needed
for Train.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/17/647917/4/check/requirements-check/
85f1533/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-28_14_12_56_612465

Change-Id: I63083b2ff8d58333e1a4e21aa103084584ae3784

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I5b4054143cb3d64d908e8eccc705c74ee3692986
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 12:52:48.000000000', 'message': 'Change duplicate OVS bridge datapath-ids

The native OVS/ofctl controllers talk to the bridges using a
datapath-id, instead of the bridge name. The datapath ID is
auto-generated based on the MAC address of the bridge's NIC.
In the case where bridges are on VLAN interfaces, they would
have the same MACs, therefore the same datapath-id, causing
flows for one physical bridge to be programmed on each other.

The datapath-id is a 64-bit field, with lower 48 bits being
the MAC. We set the upper 12 unused bits to identify each
unique physical bridge

This could also be fixed manually using ovs-vsctl set, but
it might be beneficial to automate this in the code.

ovs-vsctl set bridge <mybr> other-config:datapath-id=<datapathid>

You can change this yourself using above command.

You can view/verify current datapath-id via

ovs-vsctl get Bridge br-vlan datapath-id
"00006ea5a4b38a4a"

(please note that other-config is needed in the set, but not get)

Closes-Bug: #1697243
Co-Authored-By: Rodolfo Alonso Hernandez <ralonsoh@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I575ddf0a66e2cfe745af3874728809cf54e37745
(cherry picked from commit 379a9faf6206039903555ce7e3fc4221e5f06a7a)
(cherry picked from commit c02b1148db6c5183a9de0f032aec90e0bd5d8b9e)
(cherry picked from commit c7031e2cd303fca0c418e040e89d3428fce5dffe)
'}]
commit_message:
Change duplicate OVS bridge datapath-ids

The native OVS/ofctl controllers talk to the bridges using a
datapath-id, instead of the bridge name. The datapath ID is
auto-generated based on the MAC address of the bridge's NIC.
In the case where bridges are on VLAN interfaces, they would
have the same MACs, therefore the same datapath-id, causing
flows for one physical bridge to be programmed on each other.

The datapath-id is a 64-bit field, with lower 48 bits being
the MAC. We set the upper 12 unused bits to identify each
unique physical bridge

This could also be fixed manually using ovs-vsctl set, but
it might be beneficial to automate this in the code.

ovs-vsctl set bridge <mybr> other-config:datapath-id=<datapathid>

You can change this yourself using above command.

You can view/verify current datapath-id via

ovs-vsctl get Bridge br-vlan datapath-id
"00006ea5a4b38a4a"

(please note that other-config is needed in the set, but not get)

Closes-Bug: #1697243
Co-Authored-By: Rodolfo Alonso Hernandez <ralonsoh@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I575ddf0a66e2cfe745af3874728809cf54e37745
(cherry picked from commit 379a9faf6206039903555ce7e3fc4221e5f06a7a)
(cherry picked from commit c02b1148db6c5183a9de0f032aec90e0bd5d8b9e)
(cherry picked from commit c7031e2cd303fca0c418e040e89d3428fce5dffe)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 21:18:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add a hacking rule to check privsep import style.

Change-Id: I9b6aefa015acbf28e49a9ff1713a8bb544586579
'}, {'created': '2019-04-02 10:13:10.000000000', 'message': 'Hacking N362: Don't abbrev/alias privsep import

As noted in [1]:

We always import privsep modules like this:

    import nova.privsep.libvirt

Not like this:

    from nova.privsep import libvirt

This is because it makes it obvious at the caller that a priviledged
operation is occuring:

    nova.privsep.libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

Not just:

    libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

This is especially true when the imported module is called "libvirt",
which is a very common term in the codebase and super hard to grep
for specific uses of.

This commit introduces hacking rule N362 to enforce the above.

Change-Id: I9b6aefa015acbf28e49a9ff1713a8bb544586579
Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <openstack@fried.cc>
'}, {'created': '2019-04-04 08:44:44.000000000', 'message': 'Hacking N362: Don't abbrev/alias privsep import

commit_message:
Hacking N362: Don't abbrev/alias privsep import

As noted in [1]:

We always import privsep modules like this:

    import nova.privsep.libvirt

Not like this:

    from nova.privsep import libvirt

This is because it makes it obvious at the caller that a priviledged
operation is occuring:

    nova.privsep.libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

Not just:

    libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

This is especially true when the imported module is called "libvirt",
which is a very common term in the codebase and super hard to grep
for specific uses of.

This commit introduces hacking rule N362 to enforce the above.

Change-Id: I9b6aefa015acbf28e49a9ff1713a8bb544586579
Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <openstack@fried.cc>

commit_message:
Wait to ipv6 forwarding be really changed by L3 agent

In test test_ha_router_namespace_has_ipv6_forwarding_disabled
functional test it may happen that L3 agent will not change ipv6
forwarding and test fails because it checks that only once just
after router state is change to master.

This patch fixes that race by adding wait for 60 seconds to
ipv6 forwarding change.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py

Change-Id: I85a602561ebe9b7ab135913af49a3f010b09f196
Closes-Bug: #1801930
(cherry picked from commit 916e7745166d404f187533de702726aac3ef6eba)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I4a9a0eab03f3dd06bf2214ed6d6e8db6af5bd032
Sem-Ver: feature

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 7016, 'name': 'Swaminathan Vasudevan', 'email': 'swvasude@cisco.com', 'username': 'souminathan'}, {'_account_id': 9373, 'name': 'Vlad Gusev', 'email': 'vlad.esten@gmail.com', 'username': 's10'}, {'_account_id': 9531, 'name': 'liuyulong', 'display_name': 'LIU Yulong', 'email': 'i@liuyulong.me', 'username': 'LIU-Yulong'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26622, 'name': 'Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'neutron_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'neutron_hyperv_ci'}]
